verses.latin: In principio erat Verbum et Verbum erat apud Deum et Deus erat Verbum.
verses.english: Eternally, God the Son has been the Son of God the Father, and God the Son has had all the power, wisdom, and love of God the Father.

verses.latin: Hoc erat in principio apud Deum.
verses.english: God the Son has always been One God with God the Father and the Holy Spirit, who shares in all of the power, wisdom, and love of the Father and the Son.

verses.latin: Omnia per ipsum facta sunt et sine ipso factum est nihil quod factum est.
verses.english: All things were made by Jesus Christ Our Lord, there is nothing that was not made by him.

verses.latin: In ipso vita erat et vita erat lux hominum.
verses.english: In His light is all fulfillment and everything meaningful about life.

verses.latin: Et lux in tenebris lucet et tenebrae eam non conprehenderunt.
verses.english: And the light of Him shined in the world darkened by sin, and the dark and sinful world could not understand Him.

verses.latin: Fuit homo missus a Deo, cui nomen erat Ioannes.
verses.english: There was a man who was sent on a mission by God, and his name was John.

verses.latin: Hic venit in testimonium ut testimonium perhiberet de lumine, ut omnes crederent per illum.
verses.english: He came to be a witness, to testify concerning the light, so that all might believe in the light.

verses.latin: Non erat ille lux, sed ut testimonium perhiberet de lumine.
verses.english: He wasn't the light, but he came to testify about the light.

verses.latin: Erat lux vera quae inluminat omnem hominem venientem in mundum.
verses.english: The true light was coming into the world, which illuminates every person.

verses.latin: In mundo erat et mundus per ipsum factus est et mundus eum non cognovit.
verses.english: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, but the world did not know Him.

verses.latin: In propria venit et sui eum non receperunt.
verses.english: He came to his own people, and his own people did not receive Him.

verses.latin: Quotquot autem receperunt eum dedit eis potestatem filios Dei fieri his qui credunt in nomine eius.
verses.english: But to all who did receive Him, He gave the power to become children of God; to those who believe in His name.

verses.latin: Qui non ex sanguinibus neque ex voluntate carnis neque ex voluntate viri sed ex Deo nati sunt.
verses.english: They were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

verses.latin: Et Verbum caro factum est et habitavit in nobis et vidimus gloriam eius gloriam quasi unigeniti a Patre plenum gratiae et veritatis.
verses.english: And God the Son became a man of flesh and blood, and He lived among us. We have seen His glory, the glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.

verses.latin: Ioannes testimonium perhibet de eo et clamat dicens hic erat quem dixi qui post me venturus est ante me factus est quia prior me erat.
verses.english: John testified about Him and cried out, saying, “This is He who was to come after me, but He was before me, because He was before me.”

verses.latin: Et de plenitudine eius nos omnes accepimus et gratiam pro gratia.
verses.english: From His fullness we have all received grace upon grace.

verses.latin: Quia lex per Moysen data est gratia et veritas per Iesum Christum facta est.
verses.english: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Deum nemo vidit umquam unigenitus Filius qui est in sinu Patris ipse enarravit.
verses.english: No one has ever seen God; the only Son, who is at the Father's side, He has made Him known.

verses.latin: Et hoc est testimonium Ioannis quando miserunt Iudaei ab Ierosolymis sacerdotes et Levitas ad eum ut interrogarent eum tu quis es
verses.english: And this is the testimony of John: when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

verses.latin: Et confessus est et non negavit et confessus est quia non sum ego Christus.
verses.english: He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt eum quid ergo Elias es tu Et dixit non sum Propheta es tu Et respondit non.
verses.english: They asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei quis es ut responsum demus his qui miserunt nos quid dicis de te ipso.
verses.english: So they said to him, “Who are you, so that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?”

verses.latin: Ait ego vox clamantis in deserto parate viam Domini sicut dixit Isaias propheta.
verses.english: He said, “I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as the prophet Isaiah said.”

verses.latin: Et qui missi fuerant erant ex pharisaeis.
verses.english: Now they who had been sent were from the Pharisees.

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt eum et dixerunt ei quid ergo baptizas si tu non es Christus neque Helias neque propheta
verses.english: And they asked him, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Ioannes dicens ego baptizo in aqua medius autem vestrum stetit quem vos nescitis
verses.english: John answered them, “I baptize with water, but among you stands One you do not know.

verses.latin: ipse est qui post me venturus est qui ante me factus est cuius ego non sum dignus ut solvam eius corrigiam calceamenti.
verses.english: He is the One who comes after me, who is before me, and I am not worthy to untie the strap of His sandal.”

verses.latin: Haec in Bethania facta sunt trans Iordanem ubi erat Ioannes baptizans.
verses.english: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

verses.latin: Altera die vidit Ioannes Iesum venientem ad se et ait ecce agnus Dei qui tollit peccatum mundi
verses.english: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

verses.latin: hic est de quo ego dixi post me venit vir qui ante me factus est quia prior me erat
verses.english: This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is before me, because He was before me.’

verses.latin: et ego nesciebam eum sed ut manifestetur in Israhel propterea veni ego in aqua baptizans
verses.english: I myself did not know Him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was so that He might be revealed to Israel.”

verses.latin: Et testimonium perhibuit Ioannes dicens quia vidi Spiritum quasi columbam descendentem de caelo et mansit super eum
verses.english: And John testified, “I have seen the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained on Him.

verses.latin: et ego nesciebam eum sed qui misit me baptizare in aqua ille mihi dixit super quem videris Spiritum descendentem et manentem in ipso hic est qui baptizat in Spiritu Sancto
verses.english: I myself did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘On whomever you see the Spirit descending and remaining, He is the One who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’

verses.latin: et ego vidi et testimonium perhibui quia hic est Filius Dei.
verses.english: And I have seen, and I have testified that this is the Son of God.”

verses.latin: Altera die iterum stabat Ioannes et ex discipulis eius duo
verses.english: The next day again John was standing with two of his disciples.

verses.latin: et respiciens Iesum ambulantem dixit ecce agnus Dei
verses.english: And looking at Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”

verses.latin: et audierunt eum duo discipuli loquentem et secuti sunt Iesum
verses.english: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

verses.latin: Conversus autem Iesus et videns eos sequentes se dixit eis quid quaeritis qui dixerunt ei Rabbi quod dicitur interpretatum Magister ubi habitas
verses.english: Jesus turned, and seeing them following, said to them, “What are you seeking?” They said to Him, “Rabbi” (which means Teacher), “where are you staying?”

verses.latin: dixit eis venite et videte venerunt et viderunt ubi maneret et apud eum manserunt die illa hora autem erat quasi decima
verses.english: He said to them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where He was staying, and they stayed with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.

verses.latin: Erat autem Andreas frater Simonis Petri unus ex duobus qui audierant Ioannem et secuti fuerant eum
verses.english: One of the two who heard John and followed Jesus was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.

verses.latin: is invenit primum fratrem suum Simonem et dicit ei invenimus Messiam quod dicitur interpretatum Christus
verses.english: He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which means Christ).

verses.latin: et adduxit eum ad Iesum videns autem eum Iesus fixis oculis dixit tu es Simon filius Iona tu vocaberis Cephas quod interpretatur Petrus
verses.english: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon the son of John; you shall be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).

verses.latin: In crastinum voluit exire in Galilaeam et invenit Philippum et dicit ei Iesus sequere me
verses.english: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. And He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”

verses.latin: Erat autem Philippus a Bethsaida civitate Andreae et Petri
verses.english: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

verses.latin: invenit Philippus Nathanahel et dicit ei quem scripsit Moses in lege et prophetae invenimus Iesum filium Ioseph a Nazareth
verses.english: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the Law and also the prophets wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”

verses.latin: et dixit ei Nathanahel a Nazareth potest aliquid boni esse dicit ei Philippus veni et vide
verses.english: And Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”

verses.latin: Vidit Iesus Nathanahel venientem ad se et dicit de eo ecce vere Israhelita in quo dolus non est
verses.english: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom there is no deceit!”

verses.latin: dicit ei Nathanahel unde me nosti respondit Iesus et dixit ei prius quam te Philippus vocavit cum esses sub ficu vidi te
verses.english: Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

verses.latin: respondit ei Nathanahel Rabbi tu es Filius Dei tu es rex Israhel
verses.english: Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”

verses.latin: respondit Iesus et dixit ei quia dixi tibi vidi te sub ficu credis maiora his videbis
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”

verses.latin: et dicit ei amen amen dico vobis videbitis caelum apertum et angelos Dei ascendentes et descendentes supra Filium hominis
verses.english: And He said to him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”

verses.latin: Et die tertia, nuptiae factae sunt in Cana Galilaeae, et erat mater Jesu ibi.
verses.english: On the third day, a wedding was held in Cana of Galilee. The Mother of Jesus was there.

verses.latin: Vocatus est autem et Jesus, et discipuli ejus, ad nuptias.
verses.english: Jesus and His disciples were also invited to the wedding.

verses.latin: Et deficiente vino, dicit mater Jesu ad eum: Vinum non habent.
verses.english: When the wine gave out, the Mother of Jesus said to Him, "They have no wine."

verses.latin: Et dicit ei Jesus: Quid mihi et tibi, mulier? Nondum venit hora mea.
verses.english: And Jesus said to her, "What is that to Me and to you, woman? My hour has not yet come."

verses.latin: Dicit mater ejus ministris: Quodcumque dixerit vobis, facite.
verses.english: His mother said to the servants, "Do whatever He tells you."

verses.latin: Erant autem ibi lapideae hydriae sex, positae secundum purificatio-nem Judaeorum, capientes singulae metretas binas vel ternas.
verses.english: Now there were six stone water jars there, placed for the Jewish custom of cleansing, each holding two or three measures.

verses.latin: Dicit eis Jesus: Implete hydrias aqua. Et impleverunt eas usque ad summum.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, "Fill the jars with water." And they filled them up to the brim.

verses.latin: Et dicit eis: Haurite nunc, et ferte architriclino. Et tulerunt.
verses.english: Then He said to them, "Draw some out now, and take it to the headwaiter." And they took it.

verses.latin: Ut autem gustavit architriclinus aquam vinum factam, et non sciebat unde esset, ministri autem sciebant qui hauserant aquam: vocat architriclinus sponsum,
verses.english: When the headwaiter tasted the water that had been turned into wine, and did not know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the headwaiter called the bridegroom,

verses.latin: et dicit ei: Omnis homo primum bonum vinum ponit: et cum inebriati fuerint, tunc id quod deterius est. Tu autem servasti bonum vinum usque adhuc.
verses.english: and said to him, "Every man serves the good wine first; and when they have drunk freely, then the less good wine. But you have kept the good wine until now."

verses.latin: Hoc fecit initium signorum Jesus in Cana Galilaeae: et manifestavit gloriam suam, et crediderunt in eum discipuli ejus.
verses.english: Jesus did this as the beginning of His signs in Cana of Galilee, and manifested His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.

verses.latin: Post hoc descendit Capharnaum ipse, et mater ejus, et fratres ejus, et discipuli ejus: et ibi manserunt non multis diebus.
verses.english: After this He went down to Capernaum, with His mother, His brothers, and His disciples; and they stayed there a few days.

verses.latin: Et prope erat Pascha Judaeorum, et ascendit Jesus Jerosolymam.
verses.english: The Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et invenit in templo vendentes boves, et oves, et columbas, et nummularios sedentes:
verses.english: In the temple, He found people selling oxen, sheep, and doves, and also the money changers sitting there.

verses.latin: Et cum fecisset quasi flagellum de funiculis, omnes ejecit de templo, oves quoque, et boves, et pecuniam nummulariorum effudit, et mensas subvertit.
verses.english: And He made a whip of cords, and drove them all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and He poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.

verses.latin: Et his, qui columbas vendebant, dixit: Auferte ista hinc, et nolite facere domum Patris mei domum negotiationis.
verses.english: And to those who were selling doves, He said, "Take these things away; do not make My Father's house a house of trade."

verses.latin: Recordati sunt discipuli ejus, quia scriptum est: Zelus domus tuae comedit me.
verses.english: His disciples remembered that it was written, "Zeal for Your house will consume me."

verses.latin: Responderunt ergo Judaei, et dixerunt ei: Quod signum ostendis nobis, quia haec facis?
verses.english: The Jews then responded and said to Him, "What sign do You show us for doing these things?"

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus, et dixit eis: Solvite templum hoc, et in tribus diebus excitabo illud.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them, "Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up."

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo Judaei: Quadraginta et sex annis aedificatum est templum hoc: et tu in tribus diebus excitabis illud?
verses.english: The Jews then said, "This temple has been under construction for forty-six years, and will You raise it up in three days?"

verses.latin: Ipse autem dicebat de templo corporis sui.
verses.english: But He was speaking of the temple of His body.

verses.latin: Cum ergo resurrexisset a mortuis, recordati sunt discipuli ejus, quia hoc dicebat: et crediderunt scripturae, et verbo quod dixit Jesus.
verses.english: So when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this; and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.

verses.latin: Cum autem esset Jerosolymis in Pascha, in die festo, multi crediderunt in nomine ejus, videntes signa ejus quae faciebat.
verses.english: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the festival, many believed in His name because they saw the signs He was performing.

verses.latin: Ipse autem Jesus non credebat seipsum illis, eo quod ipse sciret omnes,
verses.english: But Jesus Himself was not entrusting Himself to them, because He knew all men,

verses.latin: et quia non opus habebat ut quis testimonium perhiberet de homine: ipse enim sciebat quid esset in homine.
verses.english: and because He had no need that anyone should testify about man, for He knew what was in man.

verses.latin: Erat autem homo ex Pharisaeis, Nicodemus nomine, princeps Judæorum:
verses.english: There was a Pharisee, a leader of the Jews, named Nicodemus.

verses.latin: hic venit ad Jesum nocte, et dixit ei: Rabbi, scimus quia a Deo venisti magister: nemo enim potest hæc signa facere, quæ tu facis, nisi Deus fuerit cum eo.
verses.english: This man came to see Jesus at night, and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher sent by God; because no one can do these signs which you do, unless God is with him.”

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus, et dixit ei: Amen, amen dico tibi, nisi quis natus fuerit denuo, non potest videre regnum Dei.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a man is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”

verses.latin: Dicit ad eum Nicodemus: Quomodo potest homo nasci, cum senex fuerit? numquid potest in ventrem matris suæ iterato introire, et nasci?
verses.english: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus: Amen, amen dico tibi, nisi quis natus fuerit ex aqua, et Spiritu, non potest introire in regnum Dei.
verses.english: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a man is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.

verses.latin: Quod natum est ex carne, caro est: et quod natum est ex Spiritu, spiritus est.
verses.english: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

verses.latin: Non mireris quia dixi tibi: oportet vos nasci denuo.
verses.english: Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’

verses.latin: Spiritus ubi vult spirat: et vocem ejus audis, sed nescis unde veniat, aut quo vadat: sic est omnis qui natus est ex Spiritu.
verses.english: The Spirit blows where He wishes, and you hear the sound of Him, but you do not know where He comes from, or where He goes. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

verses.latin: Respondit Nicodemus, et dixit ei: Quomodo potest hæc fieri?
verses.english: Nicodemus answered and said to Him, “How can these things be?”

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus, et dixit ei: Tu es magister Israël, et hæc ignoras?
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and yet you do not understand these things?

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico tibi, quia quod scimus loquimur, et quod vidimus testamur, et testimonium nostrum non accipitis.
verses.english: Truly, truly, I say to you, we speak what we know, and testify to what we have seen, and you do not receive our testimony.

verses.latin: Si terrena dixi vobis, et non creditis: quomodo, si dixero vobis cœlestia, credetis?
verses.english: If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how can you believe if I tell you heavenly things?

verses.latin: Et nemo ascendit in cœlum, nisi qui descendit de cœlo, Filius hominis, qui est in cœlo.
verses.english: And no one has ascended into the sky except the one who descended from the sky, the Son of Man, who is in the sky.

verses.latin: Et sicut Moyses exaltavit serpentem in deserto, ita oportet filium hominis exaltari:
verses.english: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up;

verses.latin: ut omnis qui credit in ipsum, non pereat, sed habeat vitam æternam.
verses.english: so that whoever believes in Him may have eternal life.

verses.latin: Sic enim Deus dilexit mundum, ut Filium suum unigenitum daret: ut omnis qui credit in eum, non pereat, sed habeat vitam æternam.
verses.english: For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

verses.latin: Non enim misit Deus Filium suum in mundum ut judicet mundum, sed ut salvetur mundus per ipsum.
verses.english: For God did not send the Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.

verses.latin: Qui credit in eum, non judicatur: qui autem non credit, jam judicatus est: quia non credidit in nomine unigeniti Filii Dei.
verses.english: He who believes in Him is not judged; but he who does not believe is judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

verses.latin: Hoc est autem judicium: quia lux venit in mundum, et dilexerunt homines magis tenebras quam lucem: erant enim eorum mala opera.
verses.english: And this is the judgment: the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

verses.latin: Omnis enim qui mala agit, odit lucem, et non venit ad lucem, ut non arguantur opera ejus.
verses.english: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed.

verses.latin: Qui autem facit veritatem, venit ad lucem, ut manifestentur opera ejus, quia in Deo sunt facta.
verses.english: But he who practices the truth comes to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, because they have been wrought in God.”

verses.latin: Post hæc venit Jesus et discipuli ejus in Judæam terram, et illic demorabatur cum eis, et baptizabat.
verses.english: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He was staying with them, and baptizing.

verses.latin: Baptizabat autem et Joannes in Ænnon juxta Salim: quia aquæ multæ erant illic: et veniebant, et baptizabantur.
verses.english: John was also baptizing in Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there; and they were coming and being baptized.

verses.latin: Nondum enim missus fuerat Joannes in carcerem.
verses.english: For John had not yet been put in prison.

verses.latin: Facta est autem quæstio ex discipulis Joannis cum Judæis de purificatione.
verses.english: Then there arose a question between some of John’s disciples and the Jews concerning purification.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad Joannem, et dixerunt ei: Rabbi, qui erat tecum trans Jordanem, cui tu testimonium perhibuisti, ecce hic baptizat, et omnes veniunt ad eum.
verses.english: And they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have borne witness, behold, He is baptizing, and all are coming to Him.”

verses.latin: Respondit Joannes, et dixit: Non potest homo accipere quidquam, nisi fuerit ei datum de cœlo.
verses.english: John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.

verses.latin: Ipsi vos mihi testimonium perhibetis, quod dixerim: Non sum ego Christus, sed quia missus sum ante illum.
verses.english: You yourselves bear me witness, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent ahead of Him.’

verses.latin: Qui habet sponsam, sponsus est: amicus autem sponsi, qui stat et audit eum, gaudio gaudet propter vocem sponsi. Hoc ergo gaudium meum impletum est.
verses.english: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled.

verses.latin: Illum oportet crescere, me autem minui.
verses.english: He must increase, but I must decrease.

verses.latin: Qui de sursum venit, supra omnes est: qui est de terra, de terra est, et de terra loquitur. Qui de cœlo venit, supra omnes est.
verses.english: He who comes from above is above all; he who is of the earth belongs to the earth and speaks of earthly things. He who comes from heaven is above all.

verses.latin: Et quod vidit et audivit, hoc testatur: et testimonium ejus nemo accipit.
verses.english: And what He has seen and heard, of that He testifies; and no one receives His testimony.

verses.latin: Qui accepit ejus testimonium, signavit, quia Deus verax est.
verses.english: He who has received His testimony has set his seal to this, that God is true.

verses.latin: Quem enim misit Deus, verba Dei loquitur: non enim ad mensuram dat Deus Spiritum.
verses.english: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for He gives the Spirit without measure.

verses.latin: Pater diligit Filium: et omnia dedit in manu ejus.
verses.english: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into His hand.

verses.latin: Qui credit in Filium, habet vitam æternam: qui autem incredulus est Filio, non videbit vitam, sed ira Dei manet super eum.
verses.english: He who believes in the Son has eternal life; but he who does not obey the Son will not see life, but the wrath of God abides on him.

verses.latin: Cum ergo cognoverit Dominus quod audissent Pharisaei, quod Iesus plures facit discipulos, et baptizat, quam Ioannes,
verses.english: The Lord realized that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John,

verses.latin: (quamquam Iesus non baptizabat, sed discipuli ejus),
verses.english: Though it was actually the disciples who were baptizing, not Jesus himself,

verses.latin: reliquit Iudaeam, et abiit iterum in Galilaeam.
verses.english: He left Judea and went back into Galilee.

verses.latin: Oportebat autem eum transire per Samariam.
verses.english: But it was necessary for him to pass through Samaria.

verses.latin: Venit ergo in civitatem Samariae, quae dicitur Sichar, juxta praedium quod dedit Iacob Ioseph filio suo.
verses.english: He arrived at a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi fons Iacob. Iesus ergo fatigatus ex itinere, sedebat sic supra fontem. Hora erat quasi sexta.
verses.english: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus, tired from the journey, sat down beside the well. It was about noon.

verses.latin: Venit mulier de Samaria haurire aquam. Dicit ei Iesus: Da mihi bibere.
verses.english: A woman from Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.”

verses.latin: Discipuli enim ejus abierant in civitatem, ut cibos emerent.
verses.english: For his disciples had gone into the town to buy food.

verses.latin: Dicit ergo ei mulier Samaritana: Quomodo tu, Judaeus cum sis, bibere a me poscis, quae sum mulier Samaritana? Non enim coutuntur Judaei cum Samaritanis.
verses.english: The Samaritan woman said to him, “How is it that you, a Jew, ask a drink of me, a Samaritan woman? For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit ei: Si scires donum Dei, et quis est qui dicit tibi, Da mihi bibere: tu forsitan petisses a eo, et dedisset tibi aquam vivam.
verses.english: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that is saying to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei mulier: Domine, neque in quo haurias habes, et puteus altus est: unde ergo habes aquam vivam?
verses.english: The woman said to him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where do you get that living water?

verses.latin: Numquid tu major es patre nostro Iacob, qui dedit nobis puteum, et ipse ex eo bibit, et filii ejus, et pecora ejus?
verses.english: Are you greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, with his sons and his livestock?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit ei: Omnis qui bibit ex aqua hac, sitiet iterum: qui autem biberit ex aqua quam ego dabo ei, non sitiet in aeternum:
verses.english: Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again, but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again.

verses.latin: sed aqua quam ego dabo ei, fiet in eo fons aquae salientis in vitam aeternam.
verses.english: The water that I will give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up to eternal life.”

verses.latin: Dicit ad eum mulier: Domine, da mihi hanc aquam, ut non sitiam, neque veniam huc ad hauriendum.
verses.english: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I may not be thirsty or have to come here to draw water.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Vade, voca virum tuum, et veni huc.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband and come here.”

verses.latin: Respondit mulier, et dixit: Non habeo virum. Dicit ei Iesus: Bene dixisti, quia non habeo virum:
verses.english: The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You are right in saying, ‘I have no husband’:

verses.latin: quinque enim viros habuisti: et nunc quem habes, non est vir tuus: hoc vere dixisti.
verses.english: for you have had five husbands, and the one you now have is not your husband.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei mulier: Domine, video quia propheta es tu.
verses.english: The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.

verses.latin: Patres nostri in monte hoc adoraverunt: et vos dicitis, quia Ierosolymis est locus ubi oportet adorare.
verses.english: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, but you say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Mulier, crede mihi, quia venit hora, quando neque in monte hoc, neque in Ierusalem adorabitis Patrem.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, the hour is coming when neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.

verses.latin: Vos adoratis quod nescitis: nos adoramus quod scimus: quia salus ex Iudaeis est.
verses.english: You worship what you do not know; we worship what we know, for salvation is from the Jews.

verses.latin: Sed venit hora, et nunc est, quando veri adoratores adorabunt Patrem in spiritu et veritate. Nam et Pater tales quaerit, qui adorent eum.
verses.english: But the hour is coming, and is now here, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father is seeking such to worship him.

verses.latin: Spiritus est Deus: et eos qui adorant eum, in spiritu et veritate oportet adorare.
verses.english: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei mulier: Scio quia Messias venit (qui dicitur Christus): cum ergo venerit ille, nobis annuntiabit omnia.
verses.english: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming (he who is called Christ). When he comes, he will tell us all things.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Ego sum, qui loquor tecum.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one speaking to you.”

verses.latin: Et continuo venerunt discipuli ejus: et mirabantur quod cum muliere loquebatur. Nemo tamen dixit: Quid quaeris? aut, Quid loqueris cum ea?
verses.english: Just then his disciples came. They marveled that he was talking with a woman, but no one said, “What are you seeking?” or, “Why are you talking with her?”

verses.latin: Reliquit ergo hydriam suam mulier, et abiit in civitatem, et dicit hominibus:
verses.english: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people,

verses.latin: Venite, et videte hominem qui dixit mihi omnia quaecumque feci: numquid ipse est Christus?
verses.english: “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?”

verses.latin: Exierunt de civitate, et veniebant ad eum.
verses.english: They went out of the town and were coming to him.

verses.latin: Interim autem rogabant eum discipuli, dicentes: Rabbi, manduca.
verses.english: Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”

verses.latin: Quibus dicit: Ego cibum habeo manducare, quem vos nescitis.
verses.english: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo discipuli ad invicem: Numquis ei attulit manducare?
verses.english: So the disciples said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

verses.latin: Dicit eis Iesus: Meus cibus est ut faciam voluntatem ejus qui misit me, ut perficiam opus ejus.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to accomplish his work.

verses.latin: Nonne vos dicitis quod adhuc quatuor menses sunt, et messis venit? Ecce dico vobis: levate oculos vestros, et videte regiones, quia albae sunt jam ad messem.
verses.english: Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months, then comes the harvest’? Look, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and see that the fields are white for harvest.

verses.latin: Et qui metit, mercedem accipit, et congregat fructum in vitam aeternam: ut et qui seminat, simul gaudeat, et qui metit.
verses.english: Already the one who reaps is receiving wages and gathering crops for eternal life, so that sower and reaper may rejoice together.

verses.latin: In hoc enim est verbum verum, quia alius est qui seminat, et alius est qui metit.
verses.english: For here the saying holds true: ‘One sows and another reaps.’

verses.latin: Ego misi vos metere quod vos non laborastis: alii laboraverunt, et vos in laborem eorum introistis.
verses.english: I sent you to reap that for which you did not labor. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”

verses.latin: Ex illa autem civitate multi crediderunt in eum Samaritani propter verbum mulieris testimonium perhibentis: Quia dixit mihi omnia quaecumque feci.
verses.english: Many Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman’s testimony, “He told me all that I ever did.”

verses.latin: Cum ergo venissent ad eum Samaritani, rogaverunt eum ut maneret ibi. Et mansit ibi duos dies.
verses.english: So when the Samaritans came to him, they asked him to stay with them, and he stayed there two days.

verses.latin: Et multo plures crediderunt propter verbum ejus.
verses.english: And many more believed because of his word.

verses.latin: Et dicebant mulieri: Jam non propter tuam loquelam credimus: ipsi enim audivimus, et scimus quia hic est vere Salvator mundi.
verses.english: They said to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this is indeed the Savior of the world.”

verses.latin: Post duos autem dies exiit inde, et abiit in Galilaeam.
verses.english: After the two days he departed for Galilee.

verses.latin: Ipse enim Iesus testimonium perhibuit, quia propheta in sua patria honorem non habet.
verses.english: For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own hometown.

verses.latin: Cum ergo venisset in Galilaeam, exceperunt eum Galilaei, cum omnia vidissent quae fecit in Ierusalem in die festivitatis: et ipsi enim venerant in diem festivitatis.
verses.english: So when he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, having seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the feast, for they too had gone to the feast.

verses.latin: Venit ergo iterum in Cana Galilaeae, ubi fecit vinum ex aqua. Et erat quidam regulus, cujus filius infirmabatur Capharnaum.
verses.english: So he came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had made the wine from water. And at Capernaum there was an official whose son was ill.

verses.latin: Hic cum audisset quia Iesus venisset a Iudaea in Galilaeam, abiit ad eum, et rogabat eum ut descenderet, et sanaret filium ejus: incipiebat enim mori.
verses.english: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and asked him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus ad eum: Nisi signa et prodigia videritis, non creditis.
verses.english: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders you will not believe.”

verses.latin: Dicit ad eum regulus: Domine, descende priusquam moriatur filius meus.
verses.english: The official said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Vade, filius tuus vivit. Credidit homo verbo quod dixit ei Iesus, et ibat.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and went on his way.

verses.latin: Jam autem ipso descendentis eo, servi ejus occurrerunt ei: et nuntiaverunt dicentes: Filius tuus vivit.
verses.english: As he was going down, his servants met him and told him that his son was recovering.

verses.latin: Informabatur ergo ab eis hora in qua melius habuerit. Et dixerunt ei: Heri hora septima reliquit eum febris.
verses.english: So he asked them the hour when he began to get better, and they said to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”

verses.latin: Cognovit ergo pater quia illa hora erat, in qua dixit ei Iesus: Filius tuus vivit: et credidit ipse, et omnis domus ejus.
verses.english: The father knew that it was at that hour when Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live.” And he himself believed, and all his household.

verses.latin: Hoc iterum secundum signum fecit Iesus, cum venisset a Iudaea in Galilaeam.
verses.english: This was now the second sign that Jesus did when he had come from Judea to Galilee.

verses.latin: Post haec erat dies festus Judæorum, et ascendit Jesus Jerosolymam.
verses.english: After these things, there was a feast day of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Est autem Jerosolymis, probatica piscina, quæ cognominatur Hebraice Bethsaida, quinque porticus habens.
verses.english: Now in Jerusalem, there is a pool, the Sheep Pool, which is called Bethsaida in Hebrew, having five porticos.

verses.latin: In his jacebat multitudo magna languentium, cæcorum, claudorum, aridorum, exspectantium aquæ motum.
verses.english: In these porticos was lying a great multitude of the sick, the blind, the lame, the withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

verses.latin: Angelus enim Domini descendebat secundum tempus in piscinam, et movebatur aqua. Et qui prior descendisset in piscinam post motionem aquæ, sanus fiebat a quacumque detinebatur infirmitate.
verses.english: For an angel of the Lord would descend at certain times into the pool, and the water was moved. And whoever first descended into the pool after the movement of the water was made whole from whatever illness held him.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi homo quidam triginta et octo annos habens in infirmitate sua.
verses.english: Now there was a certain man there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.

verses.latin: Hunc cum vidisset Jesus jacentem, et cognovit quia jam multum tempus habebat, dixit ei: Vis sanus fieri?
verses.english: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been ill for a long time, He said to him: “Do you wish to be made whole?”

verses.latin: Respondit ei languidus: Domine, hominem non habeo, ut, cum mota fuerit aqua, mittat me in piscinam: dum venio enim ego, alius ante me descendit.
verses.english: The sick man answered Him: “Lord, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is moved; for while I am coming, another steps down before me.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Jesus: Surge, tolle grabatum tuum, et ambula.
verses.english: Jesus said to him: “Rise, take up your bed, and walk.”

verses.latin: Et statim sanus factus est homo ille: et sustulit grabatum suum, et ambulabat. Erat autem sabbatum in die illo.
verses.english: And immediately the man was made whole: and he took up his bed, and walked. And it was the Sabbath on that day.

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo Judæi ei qui sanus factus fuerat: Sabbatum est, non licet tibi tollere grabatum.
verses.english: The Jews therefore said to him who was healed: “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to take up your bed.”

verses.latin: Respondit eis: Qui me fecit sanum, ille mihi dixit: Tolle grabatum tuum, et ambula.
verses.english: He answered them: “He who made me whole, He said to me: ‘Take up your bed, and walk.’

verses.latin: Interrogaverunt ergo eum: Quis est ille homo qui dixit tibi: Tolle grabatum tuum, et ambula?
verses.english: They therefore asked him: “Who is that man who said to you: ‘Take up your bed, and walk?’”

verses.latin: Is autem qui sanus fuerat, nesciebat quis esset. Jesus enim declinavit se turbam constituentem in loco.
verses.english: But he who had been healed did not know who it was. For Jesus had turned aside from the crowd that was standing in that place.

verses.latin: Post haec invenit eum Jesus in templo, et dixit illi: Ecce sanus factus es: jam noli peccare, ne deterius tibi aliquid contingat.
verses.english: After these things, Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him: “Behold, you are made whole; sin no more, lest something worse happen to you.”

verses.latin: Abiit ille homo, et nuntiavit Judæis quia Jesus esset qui fecit eum sanum.
verses.english: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had healed him.

verses.latin: Et propterea persequebantur Judæi Jesum, quia hæc faciebat in sabbato.
verses.english: And therefore the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because He was doing these things on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Jesus autem respondit eis: Pater meus usque modo operatur; et ego operor.
verses.english: But Jesus answered them: “My Father works until now; and I work.”

verses.latin: Propterea ergo magis quærebant eum Judæi interficere: quia non solum solvebat sabbatum, sed et Patrem suum dicebat Deum, faciens se æqualem Deo.
verses.english: Therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill Him: because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal to God.

verses.latin: Respondit itaque Jesus, et dixit eis: Amen, amen dico vobis, non potest Filius a se facere quicquam, nisi quod viderit Patrem facientem: quæcumque enim ille facit, hæc et Filius similiter facit.
verses.english: Jesus therefore answered and said to them: “Amen, amen, I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father doing: for whatever He does, these things the Son also does in like manner.”

verses.latin: Pater enim diligit Filium, et omnia ostendit ei quæ ipse facit: et majora horum ostendet ei opera, ut vos miremini.
verses.english: For the Father loves the Son, and shows Him all things that He Himself does: and He will show Him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

verses.latin: Nam sicut Pater suscitat mortuos, et vivificat: sic et Filius quos vult, vivificat.
verses.english: For just as the Father raises the dead, and gives them life: so also the Son gives life to whom He will.

verses.latin: Neque enim Pater judicat quemquam: sed judicium omne dedit Filio,
verses.english: For neither does the Father judge anyone, but He has given all judgment to the Son,

verses.latin: ut omnes honorificent Filium, sicut honorificant Patrem. Qui non honorificat Filium, non honorificat Patrem qui misit eum.
verses.english: so that all may honor the Son, just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son, does not honor the Father who sent Him.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis, quia qui verbum meum audit, et credit ei qui misit me, habet vitam æternam, et in judicium non venit, sed transiit a morte in vitam.
verses.english: Amen, amen, I say to you, that he who hears My word, and believes in Him who sent Me, has eternal life, and does not come into judgment, but has passed from death to life.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis, quia venit hora, et nunc est, quando mortui audient vocem Filii Dei: et qui audierint, vivent.
verses.english: Amen, amen, I say to you, that the hour is coming, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God: and those who hear will live.

verses.latin: Quia sicut Pater habet vitam in semetipso, sic dedit et Filio vitam habere in semetipso:
verses.english: For just as the Father has life in Himself, so also He gave to the Son to have life in Himself:

verses.latin: et potestatem dedit ei judicium facere, quia Filius hominis est.
verses.english: and He gave Him authority to execute judgment, because He is the Son of Man.

verses.latin: Nolite mirari hoc: quia venit hora in qua omnes qui in monumentis sunt, audient vocem Filii Dei.
verses.english: Do not marvel at this: for the hour is coming in which all who are in the tombs will hear the voice of the Son of God.

verses.latin: Et procedent qui bona fecerunt, in resurrectionem vitæ: qui mala gesserunt, in resurrectionem judicii.
verses.english: And those who have done good will come forth to the resurrection of life: but those who have done evil to the resurrection of judgment.

verses.latin: Non possum ego a meipso facere quicquam. Sicut audio, judico: et judicium meum justum est: quia non quæro voluntatem meam, sed voluntatem ejus qui misit me.
verses.english: I can do nothing of Myself. As I hear, I judge: and My judgment is just: because I do not seek My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me.

verses.latin: Si ego testimonium perhibeo de meipso, testimonium meum non est verum.
verses.english: If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true.

verses.latin: Alius est qui testimonium perhibet de me: et scio quia verum est testimonium quod perhibet de me.
verses.english: There is another who bears witness of Me: and I know that the witness which He bears of Me is true.

verses.latin: Vos misistis ad Joannem, et testimonium perhibuit veritati.
verses.english: You sent to John, and he bore witness to the truth.

verses.latin: Ego autem non a homine testimonium accipio: sed hæc dico ut salvi sitis.
verses.english: But I do not receive testimony from man: but I say these things so that you may be saved.

verses.latin: Ille erat lucerna ardens et lucens: vos autem voluistis exultare ad horam in luce ejus.
verses.english: He was a burning and shining lamp: and you for a time were willing to rejoice in his light.

verses.latin: Ego autem habeo testimonium majus Johanne: opera enim quæ dedit mihi Pater ut perficiam ea, ipsa opera quæ ego facio, testimonium perhibent de me, quia Pater me misit.
verses.english: But I have a greater witness than John: for the works which the Father has given Me to perfect them, the works themselves which I do, bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me.

verses.latin: Et qui misit me, Pater, ipse testimonium perhibuit de me: neque vocem ejus umquam audistis, neque speciem ejus vidistis.
verses.english: And the Father who sent Me, He Himself has given testimony of Me: nor have you ever heard His voice, nor have you seen His form.

verses.latin: Et verbum ejus non habetis in vobis manens: quia quem hic misit, huic vos non creditis.
verses.english: And you do not have His word abiding in you: for you do not believe Him whom He has sent.

verses.latin: Scrutamini Scripturas, quia vos putatis in ipsis vitam æternam habere: et illæ sunt quæ testimonium perhibent de me;
verses.english: Search the Scriptures, for in them you think you have eternal life: and it is they that bear witness of Me;

verses.latin: et non vultis venire ad me ut vitam habeatis.
verses.english: and you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life.

verses.latin: Claritatem a hominibus non accipio.
verses.english: I do not receive glory from men.

verses.latin: Sed cognovi vos, quia dilectionem Dei non habetis in vobis.
verses.english: But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you.

verses.latin: Ego veni in nomine Patris mei, et non accipitis me: si alius venerit in nomine suo, illum accipietis.
verses.english: I have come in the name of My Father, and you do not receive Me: if another comes in his own name, him you will receive.

verses.latin: Quomodo potestis credere, qui gloriam ab invicem accipitis, et gloriam quæ a solo Deo est, non quæritis?
verses.english: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and do not seek the glory which is from God alone?

verses.latin: Nolite putare quod ego accusaturus sim vos apud Patrem: est qui accusat vos Moyses, in quo vos speratis.
verses.english: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is one who accuses you, Moses, in whom you trust.

verses.latin: Si enim crederetis Moysi, crederetis forsitan et mihi: de me enim ille scripsit.
verses.english: For if you believed Moses, perhaps you would believe Me also: for he wrote of Me.

verses.latin: Si autem illius scriptis non creditis, quomodo meis verbis credetis?
verses.english: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?

verses.latin: Post haec abiit Iesus trans mare Galilaeae, quod est Tiberiadis.
verses.english: After this, Jesus went away across the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.

verses.latin: Et sequebatur eum turba magna, quia videbant signa quae faciebat in iis qui infirmabantur.
verses.english: And a great crowd was following Him, because they were seeing the signs that He was performing on those who were sick.

verses.latin: Subiit ergo in montem Iesus, et ibi sedebat cum discipulis suis.
verses.english: So Jesus went up into the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.

verses.latin: Erat autem proximum Pascha, dies festus Iudaeorum.
verses.english: Now the Passover, a feast day of the Jews, was near.

verses.latin: Cum sublevasset ergo oculos Iesus, et vidisset quod magna turba venit ad eum, dixit ad Philippum: Unde ememus panes, ut manducent hi?
verses.english: When Jesus had lifted up His eyes, and saw that a great crowd was coming to Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread, that these may eat?”

verses.latin: Hoc autem dicebat, tentando eum: ipse enim sciebat quid esset facturus.
verses.english: Now He was saying this, testing him: for He Himself knew what He would do.

verses.latin: Respondit ei Philippus: Ducentorum denariorum panes non sufficiunt eis, ut unusquisque modicum quid accipiat.
verses.english: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not enough for them, that each one may take a little.”

verses.latin: Unus ex discipulis eius, Simon Petrus, dixit ei:
verses.english: One of His disciples, Simon Peter, said to Him:

verses.latin: Est puer unus hic, qui habet quinque panes hordeaceos et duos pisces: sed haec quid sunt inter tantos?
verses.english: “There is a young boy here who has five barley loaves and two fishes: but what are these among so many?”

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus: Facite homines discumbere. Erat autem fenum multum in loco. Discumberunt ergo viri, numero quasi quinque milia.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. The men therefore sat down, in number about five thousand.

verses.latin: Accepit ergo Iesus panes: et cum gratias egisset, distribuit discumbentibus: similiter et ex piscibus, quantum volebant.
verses.english: Jesus therefore took the loaves: and when He had given thanks, He distributed to those sitting down: likewise also of the fishes, as much as they wanted.

verses.latin: Ut ergo impleti essent, dixit discipulis suis: Colligite quae superaverunt fragmenta, ne pereant.
verses.english: Therefore when they were filled, He said to His disciples, “Gather up the fragments that remain, lest they be lost.”

verses.latin: Collegerunt ergo, et impleverunt duodecim corbiculos fragmentorum ex quinque panibus hordeaceis, qui superfuerunt his qui manducaverant.
verses.english: They gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets of fragments from the five barley loaves, which were left over from those who had eaten.

verses.latin: Illi ergo homines cum vidissent quod fecerat Iesus signum, dicebant: Quia hic est vere propheta, qui venturus est in mundum.
verses.english: Those men therefore, when they had seen what sign Jesus had done, said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”

verses.latin: Iesus cum cognovisset quia venturi essent ut raperent eum, et facerent eum regem, fugit iterum in montem ipse solus.
verses.english: Jesus, when He knew that they would come to seize Him and make Him king, fled again into the mountain by Himself alone.

verses.latin: Vespere autem facto, descenderunt discipuli eius ad mare:
verses.english: When evening had come, His disciples went down to the sea:

verses.latin: et cum ascendissent navim, veniebant trans mare in Capharnaum: et iam tenebrae factae erant, et nondum venerat ad eos Iesus.
verses.english: And when they had entered into a boat, they were going across the sea to Capernaum: and now it was dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.

verses.latin: Mare autem vento magno flante exsurgebat.
verses.english: And the sea was rising because a great wind was blowing.

verses.latin: Cum remigassent ergo quasi stadia viginti quinque aut triginta, vident Iesum ambulantem supra mare, et prope navim fieri: et timuerunt.
verses.english: When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they saw Jesus walking upon the sea, and approaching the boat: and they were afraid.

verses.latin: Dicit ergo eis: Ego sum, nolite timere.
verses.english: He said to them therefore, “It is I, do not be afraid.”

verses.latin: Voluerunt ergo eum accipere in navim: et statim navis facta est ad terram, in quam ibant.
verses.english: They wished therefore to take Him into the boat: and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.

verses.latin: Altera die turba, quae stabat trans mare, vidit quia navicula una erat ibi, et quod non introisset cum discipulis suis Iesus in navim, sed soli discipuli eius abissent:
verses.english: The next day the crowd that was standing across the sea saw that there was only one boat there, and that Jesus had not entered into the boat with His disciples, but His disciples had gone away alone:

verses.latin: aliæ vero naviculae venerunt a Tiberiade, juxta locum ubi manducaverant panem, gratias agente Domino.
verses.english: And other boats came from Tiberias near the place where they had eaten bread, giving thanks to the Lord.

verses.latin: Cum ergo vidisset turba quia Iesus non esset ibi, neque discipuli eius, ascenderunt in naviculas, et venerunt Capharnaum quaerentes Iesum.
verses.english: Therefore, when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they went into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

verses.latin: Et cum invenissent eum trans mare, dixerunt ei: Rabbi, quando huc venisti?
verses.english: And when they had found Him across the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Iesus, et dixit: Amen, amen dico vobis: quaeritis me non quia vidistis signa, sed quia manducastis de panibus, et saturati estis.
verses.english: Jesus answered them and said, “Amen, amen I say to you, you seek Me not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.”

verses.latin: Operamini non cibum qui perit, sed qui permanet in vitam aeternam, quem Filius hominis dabit vobis. Hunc enim Pater signavit, Deus.
verses.english: “Labor not for the food that perishes, but for that which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For Him the Father, God, has sealed.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ad eum: Quid faciemus ut operemur opera Dei?
verses.english: They said therefore to Him, “What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit eis: Hoc est opus Dei, ut credatis in eum quem misit ille.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them, “This is the work of God: that you believe in Him Whom He has sent.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei: Quod ergo tu facis signum, ut videamus, et credamus tibi? quid operaris?
verses.english: They said therefore to Him, “What sign then do You do, that we may see, and believe You? What do You work?”

verses.latin: Patres nostri manna manducaverunt in deserto, sicut scriptum est: Panem de caelo dedit eis manducare.
verses.english: “Our fathers ate manna in the desert, as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from the sky to eat.’”

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis: non Moyses dedit vobis panem de caelo, sed Pater meus dat vobis panem de caelo verum.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to them: “Amen, amen I say to you, Moses did not give you bread from the sky; but My Father gives you the true bread from the sky.

verses.latin: Panis enim Dei est, qui de caelo descendit, et dat vitam mundo.
verses.english: “For the bread of God is He Who comes down from the sky, and gives life to the world.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ad eum: Domine, da nobis hunc panem semper.
verses.english: They said therefore to Him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”

verses.latin: Dixit autem eis Iesus: Ego sum panis vitae. Qui venit ad me, non esuriet: et qui credit in me, non sitiet umquam.
verses.english: And Jesus said to them: “I am the bread of life. He who comes to Me shall not hunger: and he who believes in Me shall never thirst.”

verses.latin: Sed dixi vobis, quia et vidistis me, et non creditis.
verses.english: “But I said to you that you have also seen Me, and you do not believe.

verses.latin: Omne quod dat mihi Pater, ad me veniet: et eum qui venit ad me, non eiciam foras:
verses.english: “All that the Father gives Me shall come to Me; and him who comes to Me I will not cast out.

verses.latin: quia descendi de caelo, non ut faciam voluntatem meam, sed voluntatem eius qui misit me.
verses.english: “For I have come down from the sky, not to do My own will, but the will of Him Who sent Me.”

verses.latin: Haec est autem voluntas eius qui misit me, ut omne quod dedit mihi, non perdam ex eo, sed resuscitem illud in novissimo die.
verses.english: “Now this is the will of Him Who sent Me: that of all that He has given Me, I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again on the last day.

verses.latin: Hic est enim voluntas Patris mei, ut omnis qui videt Filium, et credit in eum, habeat vitam aeternam: et ego resuscitabo eum in novissimo die.
verses.english: “For this is the will of My Father, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him may have eternal life: and I will raise him up on the last day.”

verses.latin: Murmurabant ergo Iudaei de illo, quia dixisset: Ego sum panis vivus, qui de caelo descendi.
verses.english: The Jews therefore were murmuring about Him, because He had said, “I am the living bread, Who came down from the sky.”

verses.latin: Et dicebant: Nonne hic est Iesus filius Ioseph, cuius nos scimus patrem et matrem? quomodo ergo dicit hic: Quia de caelo descendi?
verses.english: And they were saying, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does He say, ‘I have come down from the sky’?”

verses.latin: Respondit ergo Iesus, et dixit eis: Nolite murmurare inter vos.
verses.english: Jesus therefore answered and said to them, “Do not murmur among yourselves.

verses.latin: Nemo potest venire ad me, nisi Pater qui misit me, traxerit eum: et ego resuscitabo eum in novissimo die.
verses.english: “No one can come to Me, unless the Father, Who sent Me, draws him: and I will raise him up on the last day.

verses.latin: Est scriptum in prophetis: Et erunt omnes docibiles Dei. Omnis qui audivit a Patre, et didicit, venit ad me.
verses.english: “It is written in the prophets: ‘And they shall all be taught of God.’ Everyone who has heard from the Father, and has learned, comes to Me.

verses.latin: Non quia Patrem vidit quisquam, nisi is qui est a Deo, hic vidit Patrem.
verses.english: “Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He Who is from God, He has seen the Father.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: qui credit in me, habet vitam aeternam.
verses.english: “Amen, amen I say to you: he who believes in Me has eternal life.

verses.latin: Ego sum panis vitae.
verses.english: “I am the bread of life.

verses.latin: Patres vestri manducaverunt manna in deserto, et mortui sunt.
verses.english: “Your fathers ate manna in the desert, and they died.

verses.latin: Hic est panis de caelo descendens: ut si quis ex eo manducaverit, non moriatur.
verses.english: “This is the bread that comes down from the sky, so that if anyone eats of it, he will not die.

verses.latin: Ego sum panis vivus, qui de caelo descendi.
verses.english: “I am the living bread, Who came down from the sky.

verses.latin: Si quis manducaverit ex hoc pane, vivet in aeternum: et panis quem ego dabo, caro mea est pro mundi vita.
verses.english: “If anyone eats of this bread, he shall live forever: and the bread that I will give is My flesh, for the life of the world.”

verses.latin: Litigabant ergo Iudaei ad invicem, dicentes: Quomodo hic potest nobis carnem suam dare ad manducandum?
verses.english: The Jews therefore began to quarrel among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us His flesh to eat?”

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis: nisi manducaveritis carnem Filii hominis, et biberitis eius sanguinem, non habebitis vitam in vobis.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to them: “Amen, amen I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man, and drink His blood, you shall not have life in yourselves.

verses.latin: Qui manducat meam carnem, et bibit meum sanguinem, habet vitam aeternam: et ego resuscitabo eum in novissimo die.
verses.english: “He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life: and I will raise him up on the last day.

verses.latin: Caro enim mea, vere est cibus: et sanguis meus, vere est potus.
verses.english: “For My flesh is truly food: and My blood is truly drink.

verses.latin: Qui manducat meam carnem, et bibit meum sanguinem, in me manet, et ego in illo.
verses.english: “He who eats My flesh and drinks My blood, abides in Me, and I in him.

verses.latin: Sicut misit me vivens Pater, et ego vivo propter Patrem: et qui manducat me, et ipse vivet propter me.
verses.english: “As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father: and he who eats Me, he also shall live because of Me.

verses.latin: Hic est panis qui de caelo descendit. Non sicut manducaverunt patres vestri, et mortui sunt. Qui manducat hunc panem, vivet in aeternum.
verses.english: “This is the bread that came down from the sky. Not as your fathers ate, and died. He who eats this bread shall live forever.”

verses.latin: Haec dixit in synagoga docens in Capharnaum.
verses.english: These things He said as He was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.

verses.latin: Multi ergo audientes ex discipulis eius, dixerunt: Durus est hic sermo, et quis potest eum audire?
verses.english: Many therefore of His disciples, when they had heard this, said, “This is a hard saying: and who can hear it?”

verses.latin: Sciens autem Iesus apud se quia murmurarent de hoc discipuli eius, dixit eis: Hoc vos scandalizat?
verses.english: But Jesus, knowing within Himself that His disciples were murmuring about this, said to them, “Does this scandalize you?

verses.latin: Si ergo videritis Filium hominis ascendentem ubi erat prius?
verses.english: “What if you shall see the Son of Man ascending where He was before?

verses.latin: Spiritus est qui vivificat: caro autem non prodest quidquam. Verba quae ego locutus sum vobis, spiritus et vita sunt.
verses.english: “It is the Spirit that gives life: but the flesh profits nothing. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life.

verses.latin: Sed sunt quidam ex vobis qui non credunt. Sciebat enim ab initio qui essent credentes, et quis traditurus esset eum.
verses.english: “But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who were believing, and who would betray Him.

verses.latin: Et dicebat: Propterea dixi vobis, quia nemo potest venire ad me, nisi fuerit ei datum a Patre meo.
verses.english: And He was saying, “For this reason I have said to you, that no one can come to Me unless it has been given to him by My Father.”

verses.latin: Ex hoc multi discipulorum eius abierunt retro: et iam non cum illo ambulabant.
verses.english: From this time many of His disciples went back: and they were no longer walking with Him.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus ad duodecim: Numquid et vos vultis exire?
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to the twelve: “Do you also want to go away?”

verses.latin: Respondit ergo ei Simon Petrus: Domine, ad quem ibimus? Verba vitae aeternae habes.
verses.english: Simon Peter therefore answered Him: “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.

verses.latin: Et nos credimus, et cognovimus, quia tu es Christus Filius Dei vivi.
verses.english: “And we believe and have known that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Iesus: Nonne ego vos duodecim elegi? et unus ex vobis diabolus est.
verses.english: Jesus answered them: “Did I not choose you twelve? And one of you is a devil.”

verses.latin: Post haec autem ambulabat Iesus in Galilaeam: non enim volebat in Iudaeam ambulare, quia quaerebant eum Iudaei interficere.
verses.english: After this, Jesus was staying in Galilee, because He didn't want to travel in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.

verses.latin: Erat autem in proximo dies festus Iudaeorum, Scenopegia.
verses.english: Now the Jewish Feast of Tabernacles was near.

verses.latin: Dixerunt autem fratres eius ad eum: Recede hinc, et vade in Iudaeam, ut et discipuli tui videant opera tua quae facis.
verses.english: His brothers said to Him, “Leave here and go into Judea, so that your disciples also can see the works you are doing.

verses.latin: Nemo quippe in occulto quid facit, et quaerit ipse in palam esse. Haec si facis, manifesta te ipsum mundo.
verses.english: For nobody does anything in secret while seeking to be known openly. If you do these things, show yourself to the world.”

verses.latin: Neque enim fratres eius credebant in eum.
verses.english: For not even His brothers believed in Him.

verses.latin: Dicit eis Iesus: Tempus meum nondum advenit: tempus autem vestrum semper est paratum.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them: “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.”

verses.latin: Non potest mundus odisse vos: me autem odit, quia ego testimonium perhibeo de illo, quia opera eius mala sunt.
verses.english: The world cannot hate you, but it hates Me, because I bear witness of it, that its works are evil.

verses.latin: Vos ascendite ad diem festum hunc: ego non ascendo ad diem festum istud, quoniam meum tempus nondum impletum est.
verses.english: Go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast, because My time is not yet fulfilled.”

verses.latin: Haec cum dixisset, mansit in Galilaea.
verses.english: After saying this, He remained in Galilee.

verses.latin: Ut autem ascenderunt fratres eius, tunc et ipse ascendit ad diem festum, non manifeste, sed quasi in occulto.
verses.english: But after His brothers had gone up, then He also went up to the feast, not openly, but as if in secret.

verses.latin: Iudaei ergo quaerébant eum in die festo, et dicebant: Ubi est ille?
verses.english: The Jews therefore were looking for Him at the feast, and they were saying, “Where is He?”

verses.latin: Et murmur multus erat de eo in turba. Quidam enim dicebant: Quia bonus est. Alii autem dicebant: Non, sed seducit turbas.
verses.english: And there was a great murmuring about Him among the crowds. For some were saying, “He is good.” But others were saying, “No, but He deceives the crowd.”

verses.latin: Nemo tamen palam loquebatur de illo propter metum Iudaeorum.
verses.english: Yet no one spoke openly about Him, for fear of the Jews.

verses.latin: Iam autem die festo mediante, ascendit Iesus in templum, et docebat.
verses.english: But when the feast was now half over, Jesus went up into the temple and began to teach.

verses.latin: Et mirabantur Iudaei, dicentes: Quomodo hic litteras scit, cum non didicerit?
verses.english: And the Jews were marveling, saying, “How does this man know letters, not having learned?”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Iesus, et dixit: Mea doctrina non est mea, sed eius qui misit me.
verses.english: Jesus answered them and said: “My teaching is not Mine, but His who sent Me.

verses.latin: Si quis voluerit voluntatem eius facere, cognoscet de doctrina, utrum ex Deo sit, an ego a meipso loquor.
verses.english: If anyone is willing to do His will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is from God or whether I speak from Myself.

verses.latin: Qui a semetipso loquitur, gloriam propriam quaerit: qui autem quaerit gloriam eius qui misit eum, hic verax est, et iniustitia in illo non est.
verses.english: The one who speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but the one who seeks the glory of Him who sent Him is true, and in Him there is no unrighteousness.

verses.latin: Nonne Moyses dedit vobis legem? et nemo ex vobis facit legem.
verses.english: Did not Moses give you the law? And yet none of you keeps the law.

verses.latin: Quid me quaeritis interficere?
verses.english: Why are you seeking to kill Me?”

verses.latin: Respondit turba: Daemonium habes. Quis te quaerit interficere?
verses.english: The crowd answered, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit eis: Unum opus feci, et omnes miramini.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.

verses.latin: Propterea Moyses dedit vobis circumcisionem (non quia a Moyse est, sed a patribus), et in sabbato circumciditis hominem.
verses.english: For this reason Moses gave you circumcision (not that it is from Moses, but from the fathers), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Si circumcisionem accipit homo in sabbato, ut non solvatur lex Mosi, mihi indignamini quia totum hominem sanum feci in sabbato?
verses.english: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with Me because I made a whole man well on the Sabbath?

verses.latin: Nolite judicare secundum faciem, sed justum judicium judicate.
verses.english: Do not judge according to appearance, but judge with righteous judgment.”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo quidam ex Hierosolymitanis: Nonne hic est quem quaerunt interficere?
verses.english: Therefore some of the people of Jerusalem were saying, “Is not this the man whom they are seeking to kill?

verses.latin: Et ecce palam loquitur, et nihil ei dicunt. Numquid vere cognoverunt principes quia hic est vere Christus?
verses.english: And look, He is speaking openly, and they say nothing to Him. Have the rulers really come to know that this is truly the Christ?

verses.latin: Sed hunc scimus unde sit: Christus autem cum venerit, nemo scit unde sit.
verses.english: But we know where this man is from, but when the Christ comes, no one knows where He is from.”

verses.latin: Clamabat ergo Iesus in templo docens, et dicens: Et me scitis, et unde sim scitis: et a meipso non veni, sed verax est qui misit me, quem vos nescitis.
verses.english: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know Me and know where I am from, and I have not come from Myself, but the One who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.

verses.latin: Ego scio eum, quia ab ipso sum, et ipse me misit.
verses.english: I know Him, because I am from Him, and He sent Me.”

verses.latin: Quaerebant ergo eum comprehendere: et nemo misit in illum manum, quia nondum venerat hora eius.
verses.english: Therefore they were seeking to arrest Him, and no one laid a hand on Him, because His hour had not yet come.

verses.latin: De turba autem multi crediderunt in eum, et dicebant: Christus cum venerit, numquid plura signa faciet quam haec quae hic facit?
verses.english: But many of the crowd believed in Him, and they were saying, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than this man has done?”

verses.latin: Pharisaei audierunt turbam murmurantem de illo haec: et miserunt pharisaei et principes ministros ut comprehenderent eum.
verses.english: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to arrest Him.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus: Adhuc modicum tempus vobiscum sum: et vado ad eum qui me misit.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said, “For a little while longer I am with you, and then I am going to Him who sent Me.

verses.latin: Quaeretis me, et non invenietis: et ubi ego sum, vos non potestis venire.
verses.english: You will seek Me, and will not find Me, and where I am, you cannot come.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo Iudaei ad se invicem: Quo hic iturus est, quia non inveniemus eum? Numquid in dispersionem gentium iturus est, et docturus gentes?
verses.english: Therefore the Jews said to one another, “Where is this man going that we will not find Him? Will He go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?

verses.latin: Quis est hic sermo quem dixit: Quaeretis me, et non invenietis: et ubi ego sum, vos non potestis venire?
verses.english: What is this statement that He said, ‘You will seek Me, and will not find Me, and where I am, you cannot come’?”

verses.latin: In die autem magno illo festivitatis stabat Iesus et clamabat dicens: Si quis sitit, veniat ad me et bibat.
verses.english: On the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.

verses.latin: Qui credit in me, sicut dixit Scriptura, flumina de ventre eius fluent aquae vivae.
verses.english: Whoever believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, ‘Out of his heart will flow rivers of living water.’

verses.latin: Hoc autem dixit de Spiritu, quem accepturi erant credentes in eum: nondum enim erat Spiritus datus, quia Iesus nondum fuerat glorificatus.
verses.english: But He spoke this concerning the Spirit, whom those believing in Him were to receive, for the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus had not yet been glorified.

verses.latin: Ex turba ergo cum audissent hunc sermonem, quidam dicebant: Hic est vere propheta.
verses.english: Therefore some of the crowd, when they heard this statement, were saying, “This is truly the Prophet.”

verses.latin: Alii dicebant: Hic est Christus. Alii autem dicebant: Numquid a Galilaea Christus venit?
verses.english: Others were saying, “This is the Christ.” But others were saying, “Surely the Christ does not come from Galilee, does He?

verses.latin: Nonne Scriptura dicit: Quia ex semine David, et de Bethleem villa, ubi erat David, venit Christus?
verses.english: Does not the Scripture say that the Christ comes from the offspring of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”

verses.latin: Dissensio ergo facta est in turba propter eum.
verses.english: So there was a division in the crowd because of Him.

verses.latin: Quidam autem ex ipsis volebant eum prendere: sed nemo misit in eum manus.
verses.english: Some of them wanted to arrest Him, but no one laid hands on Him.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo ministri ad pontifices et pharisaeos. Et dixerunt eis illi: Quare non adduxistis eum?
verses.english: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”

verses.latin: Responderunt ministri: Numquam sic locutus est homo, sicut hic.
verses.english: The officers answered, “Never has a man spoken the way this man speaks!”

verses.latin: Responderunt ergo eis pharisaei: Numquid et vos seducti estis?
verses.english: The Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?

verses.latin: Numquid credidit in eum ex principibus aut ex pharisaeis quisquam?
verses.english: Has any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed in Him?

verses.latin: Sed turba haec, quae non novit legem, maledicti sunt.
verses.english: But this crowd, which does not know the law, is accursed.”

verses.latin: Dicit Nicodemus ad eos, qui venit ad eum nocte, qui unus erat ex illis: Numquid lex nostra judicat hominem, nisi audierit ex eo prius, et cognoverit quid faciat?
verses.english: Nicodemus, who had come to Him before, and who was one of them, said, “Does our law judge a man before it hears from him and knows what he is doing?”

verses.latin: Responderunt ei: Numquid et tu Galilaeus es? Scrutare, et vide quia propheta a Galilaea non surgit.
verses.english: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt in domos suas.
verses.english: And everyone went to his home.

verses.latin: Iesus autem perrexit in montem Oliveti:
verses.english: Jesus then went towards the Mount of Olives.

verses.latin: et diluculo iterum venit in templum, et omnis populus veniebat ad eum, et sedens docebat eos.
verses.english: And in the early morning, Jesus came back to the Temple, and the people came to Him, and He sat down and taught them.

verses.latin: Adducunt autem scribae et Pharisaei mulierem in adulterio deprehensam: et statuerunt eam in medio,
verses.english: But the scribes and Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery, and they put her in the middle.

verses.latin: dicentes ei: Magister, haec mulier deprehensa est in ipso actu adulterii.
verses.english: They said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.”

verses.latin: In lege autem Moyses mandavit nobis hujusmodi lapidare. Tu ergo quid dicis?
verses.english: Now in the Law, Moses commanded us to stone such a woman. So what do you say?”

verses.latin: Hoc autem dicebant tentantes eum, ut possent accusare eum. Iesus autem inclinans se deorsum, digito scribebat in terra.
verses.english: They were saying this to test Him, so that they might be able to accuse Him. But Jesus bent down and with His finger wrote on the ground.

verses.latin: Cum ergo perseverarent interrogantes eum, erexit se, et dixit eis: Qui sine peccato est vestrum, primus in illam lapidem mittat.
verses.english: So when they continued asking Him, He straightened up and said to them: “Let the one of you who is without sin cast the first stone at her.”

verses.latin: Et iterum se inclinans, scribebat in terra.
verses.english: And again, He bent down and wrote on the ground.

verses.latin: Audientes autem, unus post unum exiebant, incipientes a senioribus: et remansit solus Iesus, et mulier in medio stans.
verses.english: But when they heard this, they began to go out one by one, beginning with the older ones. And Jesus was left alone, with the woman standing in the middle.

verses.latin: Erigens autem se Iesus, dixit ei: Mulier, ubi sunt qui te accusabant? Nemo te condemnivit?
verses.english: When Jesus straightened up, He said to her: “Woman, where are those who accused you? Has no one condemned you?”

verses.latin: Quae dixit: Nemo, Domine. Dixit autem Iesus: Nec ego te condemnabo. Vade, et jam amplius noli peccare.
verses.english: She said: “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said: “Neither do I condemn you. Go, and sin no more.”

verses.latin: Iterum ergo locutus est eis Iesus, dicens: Ego sum lux mundi: qui sequitur me, non ambulat in tenebris, sed habebit lucem vitae.
verses.english: Jesus spoke to them again, saying: “I am the light of the world. The one who follows Me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
