verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei Pharisaei: Tu de teipso testimonium perhibes; testimonium tuum non est verum.
verses.english: So the Pharisees said to Him: “You are bearing witness about Yourself; Your testimony is not true.”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit eis: Et si ego testimonium perhibeo de meipso, verum est testimonium meum: quia scio unde veni, et quo vado: vos autem nescitis unde venio aut quo vado.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to them: “Even if I bear witness about Myself, My testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I am going. But you do not know where I come from or where I am going.

verses.latin: Vos secundum carnem judicatis: ego non judico quemquam.
verses.english: You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.

verses.latin: Et si judico ego, judicium meum verum est, quia solus non sum: sed ego et qui misit me, Pater.
verses.english: And if I do judge, My judgment is true, because I am not alone, but I and the Father who sent Me.

verses.latin: Et in lege vestra scriptum est, quia duorum hominum testimonium verum est.
verses.english: And in your law it is written that the testimony of two people is true.

verses.latin: Ego sum qui testimonium perhibeo de meipso, et testimonium perhibet de me, qui misit me, Pater.
verses.english: I am the one who bears witness about Myself, and the Father who sent Me bears witness about Me.”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo ei: Ubi est Pater tuus? Respondit Iesus: Nescitis me, neque Patrem meum. Si me sciretis, forsitan et Patrem meum sciretis.
verses.english: So they were saying to Him: “Where is Your Father?” Jesus answered: “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you knew Me, you would have known My Father also.”

verses.latin: Haec verba locutus est Iesus in gazophylacio, docens in templo: et nemo apprehendit eum, quia necdum venerat hora ejus.
verses.english: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, while He was teaching in the Temple. And no one seized Him, because His hour had not yet come.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo iterum eis Iesus: Ego vado, et quaeretis me, et in peccato vestro moriemini. Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them again: “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and you will die in your sin. Where I am going, you cannot come.”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo Judaei: Numquid interficiet seipsum, quia dixit: Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire?
verses.english: So the Jews were saying: “Is He going to kill Himself, because He said, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come’?”

verses.latin: Et dicebat eis: Vos de deorsum estis, ego de sursum sum. Vos de hoc mundo estis, ego non sum de hoc mundo.
verses.english: And He said to them: “You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.”

verses.latin: Dixi ergo vobis quia moriemini in peccatis vestris: si enim non credideritis quia ego sum, moriemini in peccato vestro.
verses.english: Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins. For if you do not believe that I AM, you will die in your sins.”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo ei: Tu quis es? Dixit eis Iesus: Principium, qui et loquor vobis.
verses.english: So they were saying to Him: “Who are You?” Jesus said to them: “I AM, that is also what I am telling you.”

verses.latin: Multa habeo de vobis loqui, et judicare: sed qui misit me, verax est; et ego, quae audivi ab eo, haec loquor in mundo.
verses.english: “I have many things to say and to judge about you; but the One who sent Me is true, and the things that I have heard from Him, these things I speak to the world.”

verses.latin: Non cognoverunt quod Patrem ejus dicebat illis.
verses.english: They did not understand that He was speaking to them about the Father.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Cum elevaveritis Filium hominis, tunc scietis quia ego sum, et a meipso facio nihil, sed sicut docuit me Pater, haec loquor.
verses.english: So Jesus said to them: “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I AM, and that I do nothing on My own, but I speak these things just as the Father taught Me.”

verses.latin: Et qui misit me, mecum est: non reliquit me solum, quia ego quae placita sunt ei, facio semper.
verses.english: And the One who sent Me is with Me. He has not left Me alone, because I always do the things that are pleasing to Him.”

verses.latin: Haec illo loquente, multi crediderunt in eum.
verses.english: As He spoke these things, many believed in Him.

verses.latin: Dicebat ergo Iesus ad eos Judaeos, qui crediderant ei: Si vos manseritis in sermone meo, vere discipuli mei eritis:
verses.english: So Jesus was saying to the Jews who had believed in Him: “If you abide in My word, you are truly My disciples.

verses.latin: et cognoscetis veritatem, et veritas liberabit vos.
verses.english: And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

verses.latin: Responderunt ei: Semen Abrahae sumus, et nemini servivimus umquam: quomodo tu dicis: Liberi eritis?
verses.english: They answered Him: “We are Abraham’s descendants, and we have never been slaves to anyone. How do You say, ‘You will be set free’?”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis: quia omnis qui facit peccatum, servus est peccati.
verses.english: Jesus answered them: “Amen, amen I say to you, everyone who practices sin is a slave of sin.

verses.latin: Servus autem non manet in domo in aeternum: filius manet in aeternum.
verses.english: Now the slave does not remain in the house forever; the son remains forever.

verses.latin: Si ergo vos filius liberaverit, vere liberi eritis.
verses.english: So if the Son sets you free, you will be truly free.

verses.latin: Scio quia filii Abrahae estis: sed quaeritis me interficere, quia sermo meus non capit in vobis.
verses.english: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants; yet you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.

verses.latin: Ego, quod vidi apud Patrem meum, dico: et vos quae audistis a patre vestro, facitis.
verses.english: I speak the things that I have seen with My Father, and you do the things that you have heard from your father.”

verses.latin: Responderunt, et dixerunt ei: Pater noster Abraham est. Dicit eis Iesus: Si filii Abrahae estis, opera Abrahae facite.
verses.english: They answered and said to Him: “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said to them: “If you are Abraham’s children, do the works of Abraham.

verses.latin: Nunc autem quaeritis me interficere, hominem qui veritatem vobis locutus sum, quam audivi a Deo: hoc Abraham non fecit.
verses.english: But now you are seeking to kill Me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this.

verses.latin: Vos facitis opera patris vestri. Dixerunt ei: Nos ex fornicatione non sumus nati: unum patrem habemus Deum.
verses.english: You are doing the deeds of your father.” They said to Him: “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father: God.”

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Si Deus pater vester esset, diligeretis utique et me: ego enim ex Deo processi, et veni: neque enim a meipso veni, sed ille me misit.
verses.english: So Jesus said to them: “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I proceeded forth and have come from God, for I did not come on My own, but He sent Me.

verses.latin: Quare loquutum meum non cognoscitis? Quia non potestis audire sermonem meum.
verses.english: Why do you not understand what I say? Because you cannot hear My word.

verses.latin: Vos ex patre diabolo estis, et desideria patris vestri vultis facere. Ille homicida erat ab initio, et in veritate non stetit: quia non est veritas in eo: cum loquitur mendacium, ex propriis loquitur, quia mendax est, et pater ejus.
verses.english: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.

verses.latin: Mihi autem, quia veritatem dico, non creditis.
verses.english: But because I speak the truth, you do not believe Me.

verses.latin: Quis ex vobis arguet me de peccato? Si veritatem dico vobis, quare non creditis mihi?
verses.english: Which of you convicts Me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe Me?

verses.latin: Qui ex Deo est, verba Dei audit: propterea vos non auditis, quia ex Deo non estis.
verses.english: He who is from God hears the words of God; for this reason you do not hear, because you are not from God.”

verses.latin: Responderunt ergo Judaei, et dixerunt ei: Nonne bene dicimus nos, quia Samaritanus es tu, et daemonium habes?
verses.english: The Jews answered Him and said: “Are we not right in saying that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Ego daemonium non habeo: sed honoro Patrem meum, et vos me honorare non facitis.
verses.english: Jesus answered: “I do not have a demon, but I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me.

verses.latin: Ego autem non quaero gloriam meam: est qui quaerit et judicat.
verses.english: I do not seek My own glory; there is One who seeks and judges.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: si quis sermonem meum servaverit, mortem non videbit in aeternum.
verses.english: Truly, truly, I say to you, if anyone keeps My word, he will never see death.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo Judaei: Nunc cognovimus quia daemonium habes. Abraham mortuus est, et prophetae; et tu dicis: Si quis sermonem meum servaverit, non gustabit mortem in aeternum.
verses.english: So the Jews said to Him: “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets also; and You say, ‘If anyone keeps My word, he will never taste death.’

verses.latin: Numquid tu major es patre nostro Abraham, qui mortuus est? Et prophetae mortui sunt. Quem te facis?
verses.english: Are You greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets also died. Who do You make Yourself out to be?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Si ego glorifico meipsum, gloria mea nihil est: est Pater meus qui glorificat me, quem vos dicitis quia Deus vester est,
verses.english: Jesus answered: “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing. It is My Father who glorifies Me, of whom you say, ‘He is our God.’

verses.latin: et non cognovistis eum: ego autem novi eum. Et si dixero quia nescio eum, ero similis vobis, mendax. Sed scio eum, et sermonem ejus servo.
verses.english: You have not known Him, but I know Him. If I say that I do not know Him, I will be like you, a liar. But I know Him and I keep His word.

verses.latin: Abraham pater vester exultavit ut videret diem meum: et vidit, et gavisus est.
verses.english: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it and was glad.”

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo Judaei ad eum: Quinquaginta annos nondum habes, et Abraham vidisti?
verses.english: So the Jews said to Him: “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”

verses.latin: Dixit eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis, priusquam Abraham fieret, ego sum.
verses.english: Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was born, I AM.”

verses.latin: Tulerunt ergo lapides ut jacerent in eum: Iesus autem abscondit se, et exivit de templo.
verses.english: Therefore they picked up stones to throw at Him, but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et praeteriens vidit hominem caecum a nativitate.
verses.english: As He was walking, Jesus saw a man who had been blind from birth.

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt eum discipuli ejus: Rabbi, quis peccavit, hic, aut parentes ejus, ut caecus nasceretur?
verses.english: And His disciples asked Him: "Teacher, who sinned, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?"

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus: Neque hic peccavit, neque parentes ejus: sed ut manifestentur opera Dei in ipso.
verses.english: Jesus answered: "Neither this man sinned, nor his parents, but the work of God should be manifested in him."

verses.latin: Me oportet operari opera ejus qui misit me, donec dies est: venit nox quando nemo potest operari.
verses.english: I must do the works of Him who sent Me, while it is day; the night is coming when no one can work.

verses.latin: Quamdiu sum in mundo, lux sum mundi.
verses.english: As long as I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.

verses.latin: Haec cum dixisset, expuit in terram, et fecit lutum ex sputo, et linivit lutum super oculos caeci,
verses.english: Having said these things, He spat on the ground and made clay with the spittle and spread the clay on the blind man's eyes,

verses.latin: et dixit ei: Vade, lava in piscina Siloë (quod interpretatur Missus). Abiit ergo, et lavit, et venit videns.
verses.english: and said to him: "Go, wash in the pool of Siloam" (which means, "Sent"). Then he went and washed, and came seeing.

verses.latin: Ergo vicini, et qui viderant eum prius quia mendicus erat, dicebant: Nonne hic est, qui sedebat et mendicabat?
verses.english: Therefore the neighbors and those who had seen him before when he was begging said: "Isn't this the man who used to sit and beg?"

verses.latin: Alii dicebant: Quia hic est. Alii autem: Non est, sed similis est ei. Ille dicebat: Quia ego sum.
verses.english: Some said, "It is he." Others said, "No, but he is like him." He kept saying, "I am he."

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo ei: Quomodo ergo aperti sunt tibi oculi?
verses.english: Then they said to him, "How were your eyes opened?"

verses.latin: Respondit ille: Homo qui dicitur Jesus, lutum fecit, et unxit oculos meos, et dixit mihi: Vade ad Siloë, et lava. Et iens lavi, et vidi.
verses.english: He answered, "The Man called Jesus made clay, and anointed my eyes, and said to me: 'Go to Siloam, and wash.' And I went and washed, and I saw."

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ei: Ubi est ille? Dixit: Nescio.
verses.english: They said to him, "Where is He?" He said, "I don't know."

verses.latin: Duxerunt ad pharisaeos eum qui fuerat caecus.
verses.english: They brought to the Pharisees the man who had once been blind.

verses.latin: Erat autem sabbatum quando lutum fecit Jesus, et aperuit oculos ejus.
verses.english: And it was the Sabbath on the day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.

verses.latin: Iterum ergo interrogabant eum pharisaei quomodo vidisset. Ipse autem dixit eis: Lutum mihi posuit super oculos, et lavi, et video.
verses.english: Then the Pharisees also asked him again how he had received his sight. He said to them, "He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see."

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo ex pharisaeis quidam: Non est hic homo a Deo, qui sabbatum non custodit. Alii dicebant: Quomodo potest homo peccator haec signa facere? Et divisio erat inter eos.
verses.english: Some of the Pharisees then said, "This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath." Others said, "How can a sinner do such signs?" And there was a division among them.

verses.latin: Dicunt ergo caeco iterum: Tu quid dicis de illo, qui aperuit tibi oculos?
verses.english: Then they said again to the blind man, "What do you say about Him, since He opened your eyes?"

verses.latin: Ipse autem dixit: Quia propheta est.
verses.english: He answered, "He is a prophet."

verses.latin: Non crediderunt ergo Judaei de illo, quia caecus fuisset, et accepisset visum, donec vocaverunt parentes ejus qui viderat.
verses.english: Then the Jews did not believe that he had been blind and received sight until they called the parents of the one who had received his sight.

verses.latin: Et interrogaverunt eos, dicentes: Hic est filius vester, quem vos dicitis quia caecus natus est? quomodo ergo nunc videt?
verses.english: And they asked them, saying, "Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?"

verses.latin: Responderunt eis parentes ejus, et dixerunt: Scimus quia hic est filius noster, et quia caecus natus est: quomodo autem nunc videat, nescimus: aut quis aperuit oculos ejus, nos nescimus: ipsum interrogate: aetatem habet, ipse de se loquatur.
verses.english: His parents answered them and said, "We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind; but how he now sees we do not know, nor do we know who opened his eyes. Ask him; he has come of age; let him speak for himself."

verses.latin: Haec dixerunt parentes ejus, quia timebant Judaeos: jam enim statuerant Judaei, ut si quis confiteretur eum Christum, extra synagogam fieret.
verses.english: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if anyone should confess that He was the Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.

verses.latin: Propterea parentes ejus dixerunt: Aetatem habet, ipsum interrogate.
verses.english: For this reason his parents said, "He is of age; ask him."

verses.latin: Ergo iterum vocaverunt hominem qui fuerat caecus, et dixerunt ei: Da gloriam Deo: nos scimus quia hic homo peccator est.
verses.english: So they called the man who had been blind again and said to him, "Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner."

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis: Sive peccator est, nescio: unum scio, quia caecus cum essem, modo video.
verses.english: Then he answered and said, "Whether He is a sinner, I do not know. One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see."

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ei: Quid fecit tibi? quomodo aperuit tibi oculos?
verses.english: Then they said to him, "What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?"

verses.latin: Respondit eis: Jam dixi vobis, et non audistis: quid iterum vultis audire? numquid et vos vultis discipuli ejus fieri?
verses.english: He answered them, "I have told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?"

verses.latin: Maledixerunt ergo ei, et dixerunt: Tu es discipulus illius: nos autem Moysi discipuli sumus.
verses.english: Then they reviled him and said, "You are His disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.

verses.latin: Nos scimus quia Moysi locutus est Deus: hunc autem nescimus unde sit.
verses.english: We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this Man, we do not know where He is from."

verses.latin: Respondit homo, et dixit eis: In hoc enim mirabile est, quia vos nescitis unde sit, et aperuit mihi oculos.
verses.english: The man answered and said to them, "This is a remarkable thing, that you do not know where He is from, and yet He opened my eyes!

verses.latin: Scimus autem quod peccatores Deus non audit: sed si quis Dei cultor est, et voluntatem ejus facit, hunc exaudit.
verses.english: Now we know that God does not hear sinners; but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, He hears him.

verses.latin: A saeculo non est auditum, quia quis aperuit oculos caeci nati.
verses.english: Since the world began it has been unheard of that anyone opened the eyes of a man born blind.

verses.latin: Nisi esset hic a Deo, non poterat facere quidquam.
verses.english: If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing."

verses.latin: Responderunt, et dixerunt ei: In peccatis natus es totus, et tu doces nos? Et ejecerunt eum foras.
verses.english: They answered and said to him, "You were altogether born in sin, and are you teaching us?" And they cast him out.

verses.latin: Audivit Jesus quod ejecissent eum foras: et cum invenisset eum, dixit ei: Tu credis in Filium Dei?
verses.english: Jesus heard that they had cast him out, and when He had found him, He said to him, "Do you believe in the Son of God?"

verses.latin: Respondit ille, et dixit: Quis est, Domine, ut credam in eum?
verses.english: He answered and said, "Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?"

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Jesus: Et vidisti eum, et qui loquitur tecum, ipse est.
verses.english: And Jesus said to him, "You have both seen Him, and He is the one who is speaking with you."

verses.latin: At ille ait: Credo, Domine. Et procidit ei, et adoravit eum.
verses.english: And he said, "Lord, I believe!" And he worshiped Him.

verses.latin: Et dixit Jesus: In judicium ego in hunc mundum veni: ut qui non vident, videant: et qui vident, caeci fiant.
verses.english: And Jesus said, "For judgment I came into this world, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may become blind."

verses.latin: Et audierunt ex pharisaeis, qui cum eo erant, et dixerunt ei: Numquid et nos caeci sumus?
verses.english: Then some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, "Are we also blind?"

verses.latin: Dixit eis Jesus: Si caeci essetis, non haberetis peccatum: nunc vero dicitis: Videmus. Peccatum vestrum manet.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, 'We see.' Therefore your sin remains."

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: qui non intrat per ostium in ovile ovium, sed ascendit aliunde, ille fur est et latro.
verses.english: I assure you, anyone who does not enter the sheepfold through the gate but climbs in another way, he is a thief and a robber.

verses.latin: Qui autem intrat per ostium, pastor est ovium.
verses.english: But he who enters by the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.

verses.latin: Huic ostiarius aperit: et oves vocem ejus audiunt, et proprias oves vocat nominatim, et educit eas.
verses.english: To him the gatekeeper opens. And the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

verses.latin: Et cum proprias oves emiserit, ante eas vadit: et oves illum sequuntur, quia sciunt vocem ejus.
verses.english: And when he has brought out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.

verses.latin: Alienum autem non sequuntur, sed fugiunt eum: quia nesciunt vocem alienorum.
verses.english: A stranger they will not follow, but they will flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers.

verses.latin: Hoc proverbium dixit eis Jesus: illi autem non cognoverunt quid esset quod loquebatur eis.
verses.english: This proverb Jesus spoke to them, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis iterum Jesus: Amen, amen dico vobis, quia ego sum ostium ovium.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the gate for the sheep.

verses.latin: Omnes quotquot venerunt, fures sunt et latrones: sed non audierunt eos oves.
verses.english: All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.

verses.latin: Ego sum ostium: per me si quis introierit, salvabitur: et ingredietur, et egredietur, et pascua inveniet.
verses.english: I am the gate. Whoever enters through me will be saved, and will come in and go out and find pasture.

verses.latin: Latro non venit nisi ut furetur, et mactet, et perdat: ego veni ut vitam habeant, et abundantius habeant.
verses.english: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life, and have it abundantly.

verses.latin: Ego sum pastor bonus. Bonus pastor animam suam dat pro ovibus suis.
verses.english: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

verses.latin: Mercenarius autem, et qui non est pastor, cujus non sunt oves propriae, videt lupum venientem, et dimittit oves, et fugit: et lupus rapit, et dispergit oves.
verses.english: The hired hand, who is not the shepherd and does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees, and the wolf attacks them and scatters them.

verses.latin: Mercenarius autem fugit, quia mercenarius est: et non est ei cura de ovibus.
verses.english: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand and cares nothing for the sheep.

verses.latin: Ego sum pastor bonus: et cognosco oves meas, et cognoscunt me meae:
verses.english: I am the good shepherd. I know my own sheep, and they know me,

verses.latin: sicut novit me Pater, et ego agnosco Patrem: et animam meam pono pro ovibus meis.
verses.english: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep.

verses.latin: Et alias oves habeo, quae non sunt ex hoc ovili: et illas oportet me adducere, et vocem meam audient, et fiet unum ovile, et unus pastor.
verses.english: And I have other sheep that are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will listen to my voice. So there will be one flock, one shepherd.

verses.latin: Propterea Pater diligit me: quia ego pono animam meam, ut iterum sumam eam.
verses.english: For this reason the Father loves me, because I lay down my life that I may take it again.

verses.latin: Nemo tollit eam a me: sed ego pono eam a meipso. Potestatem habeo ponendi eam, et potestatem habeo iterum sumendi eam. Hoc mandatum accepi a Patre meo.
verses.english: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have authority to lay it down, and I have authority to take it up again. This charge I have received from my Father.”

verses.latin: Facta est ergo iterum dissensio inter Judaeos propter has verba.
verses.english: There was again a division among the Jews because of these words.

verses.latin: Dicebant autem multi ex ipsis: Daemonium habet, et insanit: quid auditis eum?
verses.english: Many of them were saying, “He has a demon, and is mad. Why listen to him?”

verses.latin: Alii dicebant: Haec verba non sunt daemonium habentis: numquid daemonium potest caecos oculos aperire?
verses.english: Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”

verses.latin: Facta sunt autem Encenia in Jerosolymis, et hiems erat:
verses.english: At that time the Feast of Dedication took place at Jerusalem. It was winter,

verses.latin: et ambulabat Jesus in templo in porticu Salomonis.
verses.english: and Jesus was walking in the temple in the colonnade of Solomon.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt ergo eum Judaei, et dixerunt ei: Quousque animam nostram tollis? Si tu es Christus, dic nobis palam.
verses.english: So the Jews gathered around him and said to him, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Jesus: Locutus sum vobis, et non creditis: opera quae ego facio in nomine Patris mei, haec testimonium perhibent de me:
verses.english: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in my Father's name bear witness about me,

verses.latin: sed vos non creditis, quia non estis ex ovibus meis.
verses.english: but you do not believe because you are not among my sheep.

verses.latin: Oves meae vocem meam audiunt: et ego cognosco eas, et sequuntur me.
verses.english: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

verses.latin: Et ego vitam aeternam do eis: et non peribunt in aeternum, et non rapit eas quisquam de manu mea.
verses.english: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

verses.latin: Pater meus quod dedit mihi, majus est omnibus: et nemo potest rapere de manu Patris mei.
verses.english: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one is able to snatch them out of the Father's hand.

verses.latin: Ego et Pater unum sumus.
verses.english: I and the Father are one.”

verses.latin: Sustulerunt ergo Judaei lapides ut lapidarent eum.
verses.english: The Jews picked up stones again to stone him.

verses.latin: Respondit eis Jesus: Multa opera bona ostendi vobis ex Patre meo: propter quod eorum opus me lapidatis?
verses.english: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from the Father; for which of them are you going to stone me?”

verses.latin: Responderunt ei Judaei: Non propter bonum opus lapidamus te, sed propter blasphemiam: et quia tu, homo cum sis, facis te ipsum Deum.
verses.english: The Jews answered him, “It is not for a good work that we are going to stone you but for blasphemy, because you, being a man, make yourself God.”

verses.latin: Respondit eis Jesus: Nonne scriptum est in lege vestra: Ego dixi: dii estis?
verses.english: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your Law: ‘I said, you are gods’?

verses.latin: Si illos dixit deos, ad quos sermo Dei factus est, et non potest solvi Scriptura:
verses.english: If he called them gods to whom the word of God came—and Scripture cannot be broken—

verses.latin: cui Pater sanctificavit, et misit in mundum, vos dicitis: Quia blasphemas: quia dixi: Filius Dei sum?
verses.english: do you say of him whom the Father consecrated and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?

verses.latin: Si non facio opera Patris mei, nolite credere mihi.
verses.english: If I am not doing the works of my Father, then do not believe me;

verses.latin: Si autem facio: et si mihi non creditis, operibus credite: ut cognoscatis et credatis quia in me Pater, et ego in Patre.
verses.english: but if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, that you may know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”

verses.latin: Quaerebant ergo eum capere: et exiit de manu eorum.
verses.english: Again they were seeking to arrest him, but he escaped from their hands.

verses.latin: Et abiit iterum trans Jordanem in eum locum ubi erat Joannes primum baptizans: et mansit illic.
verses.english: He went away again across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing earlier, and there he remained.

verses.latin: Et multi venerunt ad eum: et dicebant: Quia Joannes quidem signum fecit nullum: omnia autem quae dixit Joannes de hoc, vera erant.
verses.english: And many came to him. They said, “John did no sign, but everything that John said about this man was true.”

verses.latin: Et credebant in eum multi.
verses.english: And many there believed in him.

verses.latin: Erat autem quidam languens, Lazarus, a Bethania, de castello Mariæ et Marthæ sororis ejus.
verses.english: There was a sick man: Lazarus, who was from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.

verses.latin: Maria autem erat, quæ unxit Dominum unguento, et extersit pedes ejus capillis suis: cujus frater Lazarus ægrotabat.
verses.english: Now Mary was the one who had poured perfume on the Lord and dried His feet with her hair. Her brother Lazarus was sick.

verses.latin: Miserunt ergo sorores ad eum, dicentes: Domine, ecce, quem amas, ægrotat.
verses.english: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus saying, "Lord, the one You love is sick."

verses.latin: Audiens autem Jesus, dixit eis: Hæc ægrotatio non est ad mortem, sed pro gloria Dei: ut glorificetur Filius Dei per eam.
verses.english: When Jesus heard this, He said, "This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified by it."

verses.latin: Diligebat autem Jesus Martham, et sororem ejus Mariam, et Lazarum.
verses.english: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister Mary, and Lazarus.

verses.latin: Cum ergo audivit quod ægrotaret, tunc quidem mansit in quo erat loco, biduo.
verses.english: So, when He heard that Lazarus was sick, He remained for two more days in the place where He was.

verses.latin: Deinde post hæc dixit discipulis suis: Eamus in Judæam iterum.
verses.english: Then after that, He said to His disciples, "Let us go into Judea again."

verses.latin: Dixerunt ei discipuli: Rabbi, modo quærebant te Judæi lapidare: et iterum vadis illuc?
verses.english: The disciples said to Him, "Rabbi, the Jews were just now seeking to stone You, and are You going there again?"

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus: Nonne duodecim horæ sunt diei? Si quis ambulaverit in die, non offendit, quia lucem hujus mundi videt:
verses.english: Jesus answered, "Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.

verses.latin: Si autem quis ambulaverit in nocte, offendit, quia lux non est in eo.
verses.english: But if anyone walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him."

verses.latin: Hæc ait: et post hæc dicit eis: Lazarus amicus noster dormit: sed vado ut a somno eum excitem.
verses.english: These things He said; and after that He said to them, "Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I am going to awaken him."

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo discipuli ejus: Domine, si dormit, salvus erit.
verses.english: Then His disciples said, "Lord, if he sleeps, he will get well."

verses.latin: Dixerat autem Jesus de morte ejus: illi autem putaverunt quia de dormitione somni diceret.
verses.english: However, Jesus spoke of his death, but they thought that He was speaking about the repose of sleep.

verses.latin: Tunc ergo dixit eis Jesus manifeste: Lazarus mortuus est.
verses.english: Then Jesus said to them plainly, "Lazarus is dead."

verses.latin: Et gaudeo propter vos, ut credatis, quoniam non eram ibi: sed eamus ad eum.
verses.english: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe. But let us go to him."

verses.latin: Dixerat ergo Thomas, qui dicitur Didymus, ad condiscipulos: Eamus et nos, ut moriamur cum eo.
verses.english: Then Thomas, called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, "Let us also go, that we may die with Him."

verses.latin: Venit igitur Jesus, et invenit eum jam quatuor dies in monumento habentem.
verses.english: So Jesus came and found that he had already been in the tomb for four days.

verses.latin: Erat autem Bethania juxta Hierosolymam quasi a stadiis quindecim.
verses.english: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.

verses.latin: Multi autem ex Judæis venerant ad Martham et Mariam, ut consolarentur eas de fratre suo.
verses.english: And many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to console them concerning their brother.

verses.latin: Marta igitur, ut audivit quod Jesus veniat, occurrit illi: Maria autem domi sedebat.
verses.english: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went to meet Him, but Mary remained in the house.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Martha ad Jesum: Domine, si fuisses hic, frater meus non fuisset mortuus.
verses.english: Then Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.

verses.latin: Sed et nunc scio quia quæcumque poposceris a Deo, dabit tibi Deus.
verses.english: But even now I know that whatever You ask of God, God will give You."

verses.latin: Dicit illi Jesus: Resurget frater tuus.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, "Your brother will rise again."

verses.latin: Dicit ei Martha: Scio quia resurget in resurrectione novissima in die.
verses.english: Martha said to Him, "I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day."

verses.latin: Dixit ei Jesus: Ego sum resurrectio et vita: qui credit in me, etiam si mortuus fuerit, vivet:
verses.english: Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in Me, though he may die, he will live.

verses.latin: et omnis qui vivit et credit in me, non morietur in æternum. Credis hoc?
verses.english: And whoever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?"

verses.latin: Dicit ei: Utique, Domine: ego credidi quia tu es Christus Filius Dei, qui in hunc mundum venisti.
verses.english: She said to Him, "Yes, Lord. I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who has come into the world."

verses.latin: Et cum hæc dixisset, abiit, et vocavit Mariam sororem suam, secreto, dicens: Magister adest, et vocat te.
verses.english: And when she had said this, she went and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, "The Master is here and is calling for you."

verses.latin: Illa ut audivit, surgit cito, et venit ad eum.
verses.english: As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came to Him.

verses.latin: Nondum autem venerat Jesus in castellum: sed erat adhuc in illo loco ubi occurrerat ei Martha.
verses.english: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met Him.

verses.latin: Judæi igitur, qui erant cum ea in domo, et consolabantur eam, videntes Mariam quod cito surrexisset et exisset, secuti sunt eam, dicentes: Quia vadit ad monumentum plorare.
verses.english: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw that Mary rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing that she was going to the tomb to weep there.

verses.latin: Maria ergo, cum venisset ubi erat Jesus, videns eum, cecidit ad pedes ejus, et dixit ei: Domine, si fuisses hic, non esset mortuus frater meus.
verses.english: Then, when Mary came where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, "Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died."

verses.latin: Jesus ergo, cum vidisset eam plorantem, et Judæos plorantes qui venerant cum ea, fremuit spiritu, et conturbavit se,
verses.english: Then Jesus, when He saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her also weeping, was deeply moved in spirit and troubled.

verses.latin: et dixit: Ubi posuistis eum? Dicunt ei: Domine, veni et vide.
verses.english: and said, "Where have you laid him?" They said to Him, "Lord, come and see."

verses.latin: Et lacrimatus est Jesus.
verses.english: Jesus wept.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo Judæi: Ecce, quomodo amabat eum!
verses.english: Then the Jews said, "See how He loved him!"

verses.latin: Quidam autem ex ipsis dixerunt: Non poterat hic qui aperuit oculos cæci, facere ut et hic non moreretur?
verses.english: But some of them said, "Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind man, have also kept this man from dying?"

verses.latin: Jesus ergo rursum fremens in semetipso, venit ad monumentum. Erat autem spelunca, et lapis positus erat super eum.
verses.english: Then Jesus, again deeply moved within Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.

verses.latin: Dicit Jesus: Tollite lapidem. Maria soror ejus qui mortuus fuerat, dicit ei: Domine, jam fœtet: quadriduanus est enim.
verses.english: Jesus said, "Take away the stone." Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, "Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days."

verses.latin: Dicit ei Jesus: Nonne dixi tibi, quia si credideris, videbis gloriam Dei?
verses.english: Jesus said to her, "Did I not say to you that if you would believe, you would see the glory of God?"

verses.latin: Tulerunt igitur lapidem. Jesus autem levatis sursum oculis, dixit: Pater, gratias ago tibi quoniam audisti me.
verses.english: So they took away the stone. Then Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, "Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.

verses.latin: Ego autem sciebam quia semper me audis: sed propter populum qui circumstat, dixi, ut credant quia tu me misisti.
verses.english: And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said it, that they may believe that You sent Me."

verses.latin: Hæc cum dixisset, voce magna clamavit: Lazare, veni foras.
verses.english: Now when He had said these things, He cried with a loud voice, "Lazarus, come forth!"

verses.latin: Et statim prodiit, qui fuerat mortuus, pedes et manus ligatus, et vultu erat involutus linteo. Dixit eis Jesus: Solvite eum, et sinite abire.
verses.english: And the dead man came forth, bound hand and foot with grave clothes, and his face was wrapped with a cloth. Jesus said to them, "Loose him, and let him go."

verses.latin: Multi ergo ex Judæis, qui venerant ad Mariam, et viderant quæ fecit Jesus, crediderunt in eum.
verses.english: Then many of the Jews who had come to Mary, and had seen the things Jesus did, believed in Him.

verses.latin: Quidam autem ex ipsis abierunt ad Pharisæos, et dixerunt eis quæ fecit Jesus.
verses.english: But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them the things Jesus had done.

verses.latin: Pontifices ergo et Pharisæi concilium fecerunt, et dicebant: Quid facimus, quia hic homo multa signa facit?
verses.english: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council and said, "What are we doing? For this Man works many signs.

verses.latin: Si dimittimus eum sic, omnes credent in eum: et venient Romani, et tollent et locum nostrum et gentem.
verses.english: If we let Him alone like this, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation."

verses.latin: Unus autem ex ipsis, Caiphas nomine, cum esset pontifex anni illius, dixit eis: Vos nescitis quidquam,
verses.english: And one of them, Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year, said to them, "You know nothing at all,

verses.latin: nec cogitatis quia expedit vobis ut unus moriatur homo pro populo, et non tota gens pereat.
verses.english: nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation should not perish."

verses.latin: Hoc autem a semetipso non dixit: sed cum esset pontifex anni illius, prophetavit quia Jesus moriturus erat pro gente;
verses.english: Now this he did not say on his own, but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,

verses.latin: et non tantum pro gente, sed ut filios Dei, qui erant dispersi, congregaret in unum.
verses.english: and not for the nation only, but that He might also gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad.

verses.latin: Ab illo ergo die cogitaverunt ut interficerent eum.
verses.english: Therefore, from that day on, they plotted to put Him to death.

verses.latin: Jesus ergo jam non manifeste ambulabat apud Judæos: sed abiit inde in regionem juxta desertum, in civitatem quæ dicitur Ephraim: et ibi morabatur cum discipulis suis.
verses.english: So Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim, and there He remained with His disciples.

verses.latin: Erat autem prope Pascha Judæorum: et ascenderunt multi Jerosolymam de regione ante Pascha, ut sanctificarent seipsos.
verses.english: And the Passover of the Jews was near, and many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.

verses.latin: Quærebant ergo Jesum, et invicem colloquebantur in templo: Quid putatis? Quia non venit ad diem festum?
verses.english: Then they sought Jesus, and spoke among themselves in the temple, "What do you think—that He will not come to the feast?"

verses.latin: Dederant autem pontifices et Pharisæi mandatum ut, si quis cognoverit ubi esset, indicaret, ut eum comprehenderent.
verses.english: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might arrest Him.

verses.latin: Iesus ergo sex diebus ante Pascha venit Bethaniam, ubi fuerat Lazarus mortuus, quem suscitavit Iesus.
verses.english: Six days before Passover, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus had been dead, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.

verses.latin: Fecerunt autem ei caenam ibi: et Martha ministrabat, Lazarus vero erat unus ex discumbentibus cum eo.
verses.english: They prepared a meal for him there, and Martha was serving them, while Lazarus was one of those reclining at table with Him.

verses.latin: Maria ergo accepit libram unguenti nardi puri, pretiosi, et unxit pedes Iesu, et extersit capillis suis pedes eius: et domus impleta est ex odore unguenti.
verses.english: Mary took a pound of pure, costly nard perfume, and she anointed Jesus’ feet and dried his feet with her hair. The house then was filled with the sweet scent of the perfume.

verses.latin: Dicit ergo unus ex discipulis eius, Iudas Scarioth, qui erat eum traditurus:
verses.english: Then, one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was going to betray him, said,

verses.latin: Quare hoc unguentum non venundatum est trecentis denariis, et datum pauperibus?
verses.english: “Why wasn’t this perfume sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”

verses.latin: Dixit autem hoc, non quia de pauperibus pertinebat ei: sed quia fur erat, et loculos habens, ea quae mittebantur, portabat.
verses.english: He said this, not because he cared about the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money bag, he was taking what was put into it.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus: Sine illam: ut in die sepulturae meae hunc servet. Semper enim pauperes habetis vobiscum: me autem non semper habetis.
verses.english: So Jesus said: “Let her alone, so she may keep this for the day of my burial. For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have me.”

verses.latin: Cognovit ergo turba multa ex Iudaeis, quia illic est: et venerunt non propter Iesum tantum, sed ut Lazarum viderent, quem suscitavit a mortuis.
verses.english: Then, a large crowd of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not only because of Jesus, but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

verses.latin: Cogitaverunt autem principes sacerdotum, ut et Lazarum interficerent:
verses.english: But the chief priests then planned to kill Lazarus too,

verses.latin: quia propter illum multi abibant ex Iudaeis, et credebant in Iesum.
verses.english: because, because of him, many of the Jews were leaving them and believing in Jesus.

verses.latin: In crastinum, turba multa quae venerat ad diem festum, cum audissent quia venit Iesus Ierosolymam,
verses.english: The next day, the large crowd that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

verses.latin: acceperunt ramos palmarum, et processerunt obviam ei, et clamabant: Hosanna! Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini, Rex Israhel!
verses.english: took palm branches and went out to meet him, and they were shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!”

verses.latin: Invenit autem Iesus asinum, et sedit super eum, sicut scriptum est:
verses.english: Jesus found a donkey and sat on it, as it is written:

verses.latin: Noli timere, filia Sion: ecce Rex tuus venit sedens super pullum asinae.
verses.english: “Do not fear, daughter of Zion: behold, your King comes, sitting on a colt of a donkey.”

verses.latin: Haec nesciverunt discipuli eius primum: sed quando glorificatus est Iesus, tunc recordati sunt quia haec de eo scripta erant, et haec fecerunt ei.
verses.english: His disciples did not understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and they had done these things for him.

verses.latin: Testimonium ergo perhibebat turba, quae erat cum eo, quando Lazarum vocavit de monumento, et suscitavit eum a mortuis.
verses.english: The crowd that was with him then testified that he had called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead.

verses.latin: Propterea et obviam illi exiit turba: quia audierunt eum fecisse hoc signum.
verses.english: For this reason, the crowd went out to meet him, because they had heard that he had done this sign.

verses.latin: Pharisaei ergo dixerunt ad invicem: Vidistis quia nihil proficimus? ecce mundus totus post eum abiit.
verses.english: Then the Pharisees said to one another, “Do you see that we are accomplishing nothing? Behold, the whole world has gone after him.”

verses.latin: Erant autem quidam gentiles, qui ascenderant, ut adorarent in festivitate.
verses.english: Now there were some Greeks among those who had gone up to worship at the feast.

verses.latin: Hi ergo accesserunt ad Philippum, qui erat a Bethsaida Galilaeae, et rogabant eum, dicentes: Domine, volumus Iesum videre.
verses.english: These approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and they were asking him, saying: “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”

verses.latin: Venit Philippus, et dicit Andreae: iterum Andreas et Philippus dixerunt Iesu.
verses.english: Philip came and told Andrew, and then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.

verses.latin: Iesus autem respondit eis, dicens: Venit hora, ut glorificetur Filius hominis.
verses.english: Jesus answered them, saying: “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis, nisi granum frumenti cadens in terram mortuum fuerit, ipsum solum manet: si autem mortuum fuerit, multum fructum adfert.
verses.english: Amen, amen, I say to you: unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains alone; but if it dies, it bears much fruit.

verses.latin: Qui amat animam suam, perdet eam: et qui odit animam suam in hoc mundo, in vitam aeternam custodit eam.
verses.english: Whoever loves his life loses it, and whoever hates his life in this world keeps it to eternal life.

verses.latin: Si quis mihi ministrat, me sequatur, et ubi ego sum, illic et minister meus erit. Si quis mihi ministraverit, honorificabit eum Pater.
verses.english: If anyone serves me, let him follow me; and where I am, there my servant will also be. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.

verses.latin: Nunc anima mea turbata est. Et quid dicam? Pater, salvum me fac ex hac hora. Sed propterea veni in horam hanc.
verses.english: Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? “Father, save me from this hour.” But for this reason I have come to this hour.

verses.latin: Pater, clarifica nomen tuum. Venit ergo vox de caelo: Et glorificavi, et iterum glorificabo.
verses.english: Father, glorify your name.” Then a voice came from heaven: “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”

verses.latin: Turba ergo, quae stabat, et audivit, dicebat tonitruum factum esse. Alii dicebant: Angelus ei locutus est.
verses.english: So the crowd that stood there and heard it was saying that it had thundered. Others were saying, “An angel has spoken to him.”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus et dixit: Non propter me haec vox venit, sed propter vos.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said: “This voice did not come for my sake, but for yours.

verses.latin: Nunc iudicium est mundi: nunc princeps huius mundi eicietur foras.
verses.english: Now is the judgment of the world; now the prince of this world shall be cast out.

verses.latin: Et ego, si exaltatus fuero a terra, omnia traham ad me ipsum.
verses.english: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all things to myself.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem dicebat significans qua morte erat moriturus.
verses.english: He said this, signifying by what kind of death he was going to die.

verses.latin: Respondit ergo ei turba: Nos audivimus ex lege, quia Christus manet in aeternum: et quomodo tu dicis: Oportet exaltari Filium hominis? quis est iste Filius hominis?
verses.english: Then the crowd answered him, “We have heard from the law that Christ remains forever. And how do you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?”

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Adhuc modicum tempus lux in vobis est. Ambulate dum lucem habetis, ut non vos tenebrae conprehendant: et qui ambulat in tenebris, nescit quo vadit.
verses.english: Jesus then said to them: “For a little while longer, the light is among you. Walk while you have the light, so that darkness may not overtake you, and whoever walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.

verses.latin: Dum lucem habetis, credite in lucem, ut filii lucis sitis. Haec locutus est Iesus, et abiit, et abscondit se ab eis.
verses.english: While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become sons of light.” Jesus spoke these words, and he went away and hid himself from them.

verses.latin: Tanta autem signa fecit coram eis, non credebant in eum:
verses.english: Although he had done so many signs before them, they did not believe in him:

verses.latin: ut sermo Isaiae prophetae compleretur, quem dixit: Domine, quis credidit auditui nostro? et brachium Domini cui revelatum est?
verses.english: so that the word of the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled, which he said: “Lord, who has believed our report, and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”

verses.latin: Non poterant ergo credere, quia iterum dixit Isaias:
verses.english: Therefore, they could not believe, because Isaiah said again:

verses.latin: Excacavit oculos eorum, et induravit cor eorum: ut non videant oculis, et non intelligant corde, et convertantur, et sanem eos.
verses.english: “He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, so that they might not see with their eyes, understand with their heart, and turn back, and I heal them.”

verses.latin: Haec dixit Isaias, quando vidit gloriam eius, et locutus est de eo.
verses.english: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory and spoke about him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen et ex principibus multi crediderunt in eum: sed propter Pharisaeos non confitebantur, ut eiciantur de synagoga.
verses.english: Nevertheless, even many of the rulers believed in him, but because of the Pharisees, they did not confess him, so that they would not be put out of the synagogue.

verses.latin: Dilexerunt enim gloriam hominum magis quam gloriam Dei.
verses.english: For they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God.

verses.latin: Iesus autem clamavit et dixit: Qui credit in me, non credit in me, sed in eum qui misit me.
verses.english: Then Jesus cried out and said: “He who believes in me does not believe in me, but in him who sent me.

verses.latin: Et qui videt me, videt eum qui misit me.
verses.english: And he who sees me sees him who sent me.

verses.latin: Ego lux in mundum veni, ut omnis qui credit in me, in tenebris non maneat.
verses.english: I have come as light into the world, so that everyone who believes in me might not remain in darkness.

verses.latin: Et si quis audierit verba mea, et non custodierit, ego non iudico eum: non enim misi ut iudicem mundum, sed ut salvificem mundum.
verses.english: And if anyone hears my words and does not keep them, I do not judge him, because I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.

verses.latin: Qui spernit me, et non accipit verba mea, habet qui iudicet eum. Sermo quem locutus sum, ille iudicabit eum in novissimo die.
verses.english: Whoever rejects me and does not receive my words has one who judges him. The word that I have spoken will judge him on the last day.

verses.latin: Quia ego a me ipso non sum locutus: sed qui misit me Pater, ipse mihi mandatum dedit quid dicam, et quid loquar.
verses.english: For I have not spoken on my own, but the Father who sent me has given me a commandment about what I should say and what I should speak.

verses.latin: Et scio quia mandatum eius vita aeterna est. Quae ergo ego loquor, sic loquor sicut dixit mihi Pater.
verses.english: And I know that his commandment is eternal life. Therefore, what I speak, I speak as the Father has told me.”

verses.latin: Ante diem festum Paschae, sciens Iesus quia venit hora eius ut transeat ex hoc mundo ad Patrem: cum dilexisset suos, qui erant in mundo, in finem dilexit eos.
verses.english: Before the feast of the Passover, Jesus knew that his time had come to depart from this world to the Father. And because He had loved his own who were in the world, He loved them to the very end.

verses.latin: Et cena facta, cum diabolus iam misisset in cor ut traderet eum Iudas Simonis scariotis,
verses.english: And when supper was finished, since the devil had already put it in the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, that he should betray Him,

verses.latin: sciens quia omnia dedit ei Pater in manus, et quia a Deo exivit, et ad Deum vadit,
verses.english: Jesus knew that the Father had given him all things into his hands, and that He had come from God and was going back to God,

verses.latin: surgit a cena, et ponit vestimenta sua: et cum accepisset linteum, praecinxit se.
verses.english: He rose from supper, and laid aside his garments; and having taken a towel, He girded himself.

verses.latin: Deinde misit aquam in pelvim, et coepit lavare pedes discipulorum, et exsiccare linteo, quo erat praecinctus.
verses.english: Then he poured water into a basin, and began to wash the feet of the disciples, and to wipe them with the towel with which he was girded.

verses.latin: Venit ergo ad Simonem Petrum. Et dicit ei Petrus: Domine, tu mihi lavas pedes?
verses.english: Then He came to Simon Peter. And Peter said to Him, “Lord, do you wash my feet?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit ei: Quod ego facio, tu nescis modo, scies autem postea.
verses.english: Jesus answered and said to him, “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will know it hereafter.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Petrus: Non lavabis mihi pedes in aeternum.
verses.english: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet.”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Si non lavero te, non habebis partem mecum.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with me.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Simon Petrus: Domine, non tantum pedes meos, sed et manus et caput.
verses.english: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.”

verses.latin: Dicit Iesus ei: Qui lotus est, non indiget nisi ut pedes lavet, sed est mundus totus. Et vos mundi estis, sed non omnes.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “He who has bathed does not need to wash, except for his feet, but is clean all over. And you are clean, but not all.”

verses.latin: Sciebat enim, quisnam esset, qui traderet eum: propterea dixit: Non estis omnes mundi.
verses.english: For He knew who it was that would betray Him; that is why He said, “You are not all clean.”

verses.latin: Postquam ergo lavit pedes eorum, et accepit vestimenta sua, recubuit iterum: et dixit eis: Scitis quid fecerim vobis?
verses.english: When therefore he had washed their feet, and taken his garments, and reclined at table again, he said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?”

verses.latin: Vos vocatis me Magister et Domine: et bene dicitis: sum enim.
verses.english: “You call me Teacher and Lord, and you are right; for so I am.”

verses.latin: Si ergo ego, Dominus et Magister, lavi vobis pedes: et vos debetis alter alterius lavare pedes.
verses.english: “If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another's feet.”

verses.latin: Exemplum enim dedi vobis, ut et vos, sicut ego feci vobis, faciatis.
verses.english: “For I have given you an example, so that you also should do as I have done to you.”

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: non est servus major domino suo: neque apostolus major eo qui misit eum.
verses.english: “Truly, truly, I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master; nor is an apostle greater than the one who sent him.”

verses.latin: Si haec scitis, beati eritis si feceritis ea.
verses.english: “If you know these things, you are blessed if you do them.”

verses.latin: Non de omnibus vobis dico: ego scio quos elegerim. Sed ut impleatur scriptura: Qui manducat mecum panem, levavit contra me calcaneum suum.
verses.english: “I am not speaking of all of you; I know whom I have chosen. But it is that the scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats my bread has lifted up his heel against me.’”

verses.latin: A modo dico vobis, priusquam fiat: ut cum factum fuerit, credatis quia ego sum.
verses.english: “I tell you this now, before it happens, that when it does happen you may believe that I am he.”

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: qui accipit quem misero, me accipit: et qui me accipit, accipit eum qui me misit.
verses.english: “Truly, truly, I say to you, he who receives whomever I send, receives me; and he who receives me, receives him who sent me.”

verses.latin: Haec cum dixisset Iesus, turbatus est spiritu: et testatus est, et dixit: Amen, amen dico vobis, quia unus ex vobis traditurus est me.
verses.english: When Jesus had said these things, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, “Truly, truly, I say to you, one of you will betray me.”

verses.latin: Aspiciebat ergo discipuli eius ad invicem, haesitantes de quo diceret.
verses.english: The disciples looked at one another, at a loss as to whom he was speaking.

verses.latin: Erat autem unus ex discipulis eius recumbens in sinu Iesu, quem diligebat Iesus.
verses.english: One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was reclining at table in Jesus' bosom.

verses.latin: Innuit ergo huic Simon Petrus, et dixit ei: Quis est de quo dicit?
verses.english: So Simon Peter motioned to him to ask who it was of whom he spoke.

verses.latin: Itaque cum recubuisset ille supra pectus Iesu, dicit ei: Domine, quis est?
verses.english: Then leaning back on Jesus' breast, he said to him, “Lord, who is it?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Ille est, cui ego intinctum panem porrexero. Et cum intinxisset panem, dedit Iudae Simonis scariotis.
verses.english: Jesus answered, “It is he to whom I shall give this morsel when I have dipped it.” So when he had dipped the morsel, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

verses.latin: Et post buccellam, introivit in eum Satanas. Dixit ergo ei Iesus: Quod facis, fac citius.
verses.english: After the morsel, Satan entered into him. Jesus therefore said to him, “What you are going to do, do quickly.”

verses.latin: Hoc autem nemo scivit ex discumbentibus, ad quid hoc dixit ei.
verses.english: Now no one at the table knew why he said this to him.

verses.latin: Quidam enim putabant, quia loculos habebat Iudas, quod dixisset ei Iesus: Emo ea quae nobis necessaria sunt ad diem festum, aut pauperibus aliquid dem.
verses.english: Some thought that, because Judas had the money box, Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.

verses.latin: Ipse igitur cum accepisset buccellam, exivit statim. Erat autem nox.
verses.english: So, after receiving the morsel, he immediately went out. And it was night.

verses.latin: Cum ergo exisset, dixit Iesus: Nunc clarificatus est Filius hominis, et Deus clarificatus est in eo.
verses.english: When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.”

verses.latin: Si Deus clarificatus est in eo, et Deus clarificabit eum in semetipso: et continuo clarificabit eum.
verses.english: “If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and will glorify him at once.”

verses.latin: Filioli, adhuc modicum vobiscum sum. Quaeretis me: et sicut dixi Judaeis: Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire: et vobis dico modo.
verses.english: “Little children, yet a little while I am with you. You will seek me; and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going you cannot come,’ so now I say to you.”

verses.latin: Mandatum novum do vobis: ut diligatis invicem: ut quemadmodum dilexi vos, et vos diligatis invicem.
verses.english: “A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; even as I have loved you, that you also love one another.”

verses.latin: In hoc cognoscent omnes quia discipuli mei estis, si dilectionem habueritis ad invicem.
verses.english: “By this all men will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Simon Petrus: Domine, quo vadis? Respondit Iesus: Quo ego vado, non potes modo me sequi: sequeris autem postea.
verses.english: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going you cannot follow me now; but you will follow afterwards.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Petrus: Domine, quare non possum sequi te modo? Animam meam pro te ponam.
verses.english: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can I not follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Animam tuam pro me pones? Amen, amen dico tibi, non cantabit gallus, donec ter me neges.
verses.english: Jesus answered, “Will you lay down your life for me? Truly, truly, I say to you, the cock will not crow, till you have denied me three times.”

verses.latin: Non turbetur cor vestrum: creditis in Deum, et in me credite.
verses.english: Do not let your hearts be troubled. You believe in God, so believe also in me.

verses.latin: In domo Patris mei mansiones multae sunt. Si quo minus, dixissem vobis: quia vado parare vobis locum.
verses.english: My Father's house has many rooms. If it were otherwise, would I have told you that I am going to prepare a place for you?

verses.latin: Et si abiero, et praeparavero vobis locum, iterum venio, et accipiam vos ad meipsum: ut ubi ego sum, et vos sitis.
verses.english: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and will take you to myself, so that where I am, you may be also.

verses.latin: Et quo ego vado, scitis, et viam scitis.
verses.english: And you know the way where I am going.

verses.latin: Dicit ei Thomas: Domine, nescimus quo vadis: et quomodo possumus scire viam?
verses.english: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we do not know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Ego sum via, et veritas, et vita. Nemo venit ad Patrem, nisi per me.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

verses.latin: Si cognovissetis me, et Patrem meum utique cognovissetis: et amodo cognoscetis eum, et vidistis eum.
verses.english: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on you do know him and have seen him.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Philippus: Domine, ostende nobis Patrem, et sufficit nobis.
verses.english: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be satisfied.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Tanto tempore vobiscum sum, et non cognovisti me? Philippe, qui vidit me, vidit et Patrem. Quomodo tu dicis: Ostende nobis Patrem?
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you so long, and you still do not know me, Philip? Whoever has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

verses.latin: Non creditis quia ego in Patre, et Pater in me est? Verba quae ego loquor vobis, a meipso non loquor: Pater autem in me manens, ipse facit opera.
verses.english: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I do not speak on my own, but the Father who dwells in me does his works.

verses.latin: Credite mihi quia ego in Patre, et Pater in me: alioquin propter opera ipsa credite.
verses.english: Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father is in me, or else believe on account of the works themselves.

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis, qui credit in me, opera quae ego facio, et ipse faciet, et majora horum faciet: quia ego ad Patrem vado.
verses.english: “Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever believes in me will also do the works that I do, and greater works than these will he do, because I am going to the Father.

verses.latin: Et quodcumque petieritis in nomine meo, hoc faciam: ut glorificetur Pater in Filio.
verses.english: Whatever you ask in my name, this I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

verses.latin: Si quid petieritis me in nomine meo, hoc faciam.
verses.english: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it.

verses.latin: Si diligitis me, mandata mea servate.
verses.english: “If you love me, you will keep my commandments.

verses.latin: Et ego rogabo Patrem, et alium Paraclitum dabit vobis, ut maneat vobiscum in aeternum.
verses.english: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, to be with you forever,

verses.latin: Spiritum veritatis, quem mundus non potest accipere, quia non videt eum, nec scit eum: vos autem cognoscetis eum, quia manet vobiscum, et in vobis erit.
verses.english: even the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees him nor knows him. You know him, for he dwells with you and will be in you.

verses.latin: Non relinquam vos orphanos: venio ad vos.
verses.english: “I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.

verses.latin: Adhuc modicum, et mundus me jam non videt. Vos autem videtis me: quia ego vivo, et vos vivetis.
verses.english: Yet a little while and the world will see me no more, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.

verses.latin: In die illo vos cognoscetis quia ego in Patre meo, et vos in me, et ego in vobis.
verses.english: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.

verses.latin: Qui habet mandata mea, et servat ea: ille est qui diligit me. Qui autem diligit me, diligetur a Patre meo: et ego diligam eum, et manifestabo ei meipsum.
verses.english: Whoever has my commandments and keeps them, he it is who loves me. And he who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and manifest myself to him.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iudas, non Iscariotes: Domine, quid factum est, quia nobis manifestaturus es teipsum, et non mundo?
verses.english: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, how is it that you will manifest yourself to us, and not to the world?”

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus, et dixit ei: Si quis diligit me, sermonem meum servabit: et Pater meus diliget eum, et ad eum veniemus, et mansionem apud eum faciemus.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, “If anyone loves me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.

verses.latin: Qui non diligit me, sermones meos non servat. Et sermo quem audistis, non est meus: sed ejus qui misit me, Patris.
verses.english: Whoever does not love me does not keep my words. And the word that you hear is not mine but the Father’s who sent me.

verses.latin: Haec locutus sum vobis manens vobiscum.
verses.english: “These things I have spoken to you while I am still with you.

verses.latin: Paraclitus autem Spiritus Sanctus, quem mittet Pater in nomine meo, ille vos docebit omnia, et suggeret vobis omnia quaecumque dixero vobis.
verses.english: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things and bring to your remembrance all that I have said to you.

verses.latin: Pacem relinquo vobis, pacem meam do vobis: non quomodo mundus dat, ego do vobis. Non turbetur cor vestrum, neque formidet.
verses.english: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, nor let them be afraid.

verses.latin: Audistis quia ego dixi vobis: Vado, et venio ad vos. Si diligeretis me, gauderetis utique, quia vado ad Patrem: quia Pater major me est.
verses.english: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away, and I will come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

verses.latin: Et nunc dixi vobis priusquam fiat: ut cum factum fuerit, credatis.
verses.english: And now I have told you before it takes place, so that when it does take place, you may believe.

verses.latin: Jam non multa loquar vobiscum. Venit enim princeps mundi hujus: et in me non habet quicquam.
verses.english: I will no longer talk much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming. And he has nothing in me.

verses.latin: Sed ut cognoscat mundus quia diligo Patrem, et sicut mandatum mihi dedit Pater, sic facio. Surgite, eamus hinc.
verses.english: But I do as the Father has commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. Rise up, let us go from here.

verses.latin: Ego sum vitis vera: et Pater meus agricola est.
verses.english: I am the true vine, and My Father is the farmer.

verses.latin: Omnem palmitem in me non ferentem fructum, tollet eum: et omnem ferentem fructum, purgabit eum, ut fructum plus afferat.
verses.english: He cuts off every branch in Me that doesn't produce fruit. And the branches that bear fruit, He prunes so that it may produce more.

verses.latin: Iam vos mundi estis propter sermonem quem locutus sum vobis.
verses.english: You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.

verses.latin: Manete in me, et ego in vobis. Sicut palmes non potest ferre fructum a semetipso, nisi manserit in vite, sic nec vos, nisi in me manseritis.
verses.english: Remain in Me, and I will remain in you. A branch cannot bear fruit by itself, it must remain in the vine, so neither can you unless you remain in Me.

verses.latin: Ego sum vitis, vos palmites: qui manet in me, et ego in eo, hic fert fructum multum: quia sine me nihil potestis facere.
verses.english: I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who remain in Me and I in them produce much fruit, because apart from Me you can do nothing.

verses.latin: Si quis in me non manserit, mittetur foras sicut palmes, et arescet, et colligunt eum, et in ignem mittunt, et ardet.
verses.english: If anyone does not remain in Me, they are thrown outside like a branch and wither. Such branches are gathered, thrown into the fire, and burned.

verses.latin: Si manseritis in me, et verba mea in vobis manserint, quodcumque volueritis, petetis, et fiet vobis.
verses.english: If you remain in Me, and My words remain in you, you can ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.

verses.latin: In hoc clarificatus est Pater meus: ut fructum plurimum feratis, et efficiamini discipuli mei.
verses.english: My Father is glorified in this: that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be My disciples.

verses.latin: Sicut dilexit me Pater, et ego dilexi vos. Manete in dilectione mea.
verses.english: As the Father has loved Me, so have I loved you. Remain in My love.

verses.latin: Si præcepta mea servaveritis, manebitis in dilectione mea: sicut et ego Patris mei præcepta servavi, et maneo in ejus dilectione.
verses.english: If you keep My commandments, you will remain in My love, just as I have kept My Father's commandments and remain in His love.

verses.latin: Hæc locutus sum vobis, ut gaudium meum in vobis sit, et gaudium vestrum impleatur.
verses.english: I have told you these things so that My joy may be in you, and that your joy may be complete.

verses.latin: Hoc est præceptum meum, ut diligatis invicem, sicut dilexi vos.
verses.english: This is My commandment: that you love one another, as I have loved you.

verses.latin: Majorem hac dilectionem nemo habet, ut animam suam ponat quis pro amicis suis.
verses.english: No one has greater love than this: that they lay down their life for their friends.

verses.latin: Vos amici mei estis, si feceritis quæ ego præcipio vobis.
verses.english: You are My friends if you do what I command you.

verses.latin: Jam non dicam vos servos: quia servus nescit quid facit dominus ejus. Vos autem dixi amicos: quia omnia quæcumque audivi a Patre meo, nota feci vobis.
verses.english: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because I have made known to you everything I have heard from My Father.

verses.latin: Non vos me elegistis, sed ego elegi vos: et posui vos ut eatis, et fructum afferatis, et fructus vester maneat: ut quodcumque petieritis Patrem in nomine meo, det vobis.
verses.english: You did not choose Me, but I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that will last, so that whatever you ask the Father in My name, He may give you.

verses.latin: Hæc mando vobis: ut diligatis invicem.
verses.english: This I command you: that you love one another.

verses.latin: Si mundus vos odit, scitote quia me priorem vobis odio habuit.
verses.english: If the world hates you, know that it hated Me before it hated you.

verses.latin: Si de mundo essetis, mundus quod suum erat diligeret: sed quia de mundo non estis, sed ego elegi vos de mundo, propterea odit vos mundus.
verses.english: If you belonged to the world, the world would love its own; but because you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, the world hates you.

verses.latin: Mementote sermonis mei, quem ego dixi vobis: Non est servus major domino suo. Si me persecuti sunt, et vos persequentur: si sermonem meum servaverunt, et vestrum servabunt.
verses.english: Remember the word that I said to you: 'A servant is not greater than his master.' If they persecuted Me, they will persecute you also. If they kept My word, they will keep yours also.

verses.latin: Sed hæc omnia facient vobis propter nomen meum: quia nesciunt eum qui misit me.
verses.english: But they will do all these things to you on account of My name, because they do not know the One who sent Me.

verses.latin: Si non venissem, et locutus eis non fuissem, peccatum non haberent: nunc autem excusationem non habent de peccato suo.
verses.english: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

verses.latin: Qui me odit, et Patrem meum odit.
verses.english: Those who hate Me, hate My Father also.

verses.latin: Si opera non fecissem in eis, quæ nemo alius fecit, peccatum non haberent: nunc autem et viderunt, et oderunt et me et Patrem meum.
verses.english: If I had not done among them the works that no one else did, they would not have sin. But now they have seen and they hate both Me and My Father.

verses.latin: Sed ut impleatur sermo, qui in lege eorum scriptus est: Quia odio habuerunt me gratis.
verses.english: But this is to fulfill the word that is written in their law: 'They hated Me without cause.'

verses.latin: Cum autem venerit Paraclitus, quem ego mittam vobis a Patre, Spiritus veritatis, qui a Patre procedit, ipse testimonium perhibebit de me.
verses.english: When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will bear witness about Me.

verses.latin: Et vos testimonium perhibebitis, quia ab initio mecum estis.
verses.english: And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.

verses.latin: Haec locutus sum vobis, ut non scandalizemini.
verses.english: I have told you these things so that you do not lose faith.

verses.latin: Absque synagogis facient vos: sed venit hora, ut omnis, qui interficit vos, putet se obsequium praestare Deo.
verses.english: They will cast you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time is coming when anyone who kills you will think they are offering a service to God.

verses.latin: Et haec facient, quia non noverunt Patrem neque me.
verses.english: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor Me.

verses.latin: Sed haec locutus sum vobis, ut cum venerit hora eorum, recordemini quia ego dixi vobis.
verses.english: But I have told you these things so that when their hour comes, you may remember that I told you of them.

verses.latin: Haec autem vobis ab initio non dixi, quia vobiscum eram.
verses.english: I did not tell you these things at the beginning, because I was with you.

verses.latin: Nunc autem vado ad eum qui misit me: et nemo ex vobis interrogat me: Quo vadis?
verses.english: Now, I am going to the One Who sent Me, and yet not one of you asks Me, 'Where are You going?'

verses.latin: sed quia haec locutus sum vobis, tristitia implevit cor vestrum.
verses.english: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your hearts.

verses.latin: Sed ego dico vobis veritatem: expedit vobis ut ego vadam: si enim ego non abiero, Paraclitus non veniet ad vos: si autem abiero, mittam eum ad vos.
verses.english: But I tell you the truth: It is better for you that I go, for if I do not go, the Advocate will not come to you, but if I go, I will send Him to you.

verses.latin: Et cum venerit, arguet mundum de peccato, et de justitia, et de judicio:
verses.english: And when He comes, He will convict the world concerning sin, righteousness, and judgment:

verses.latin: de peccato quidem, quia non crediderunt in me;
verses.english: concerning sin, because they have not believed in Me;

verses.latin: de justitia autem, quia ad Patrem vado, et jam non me videbitis;
verses.english: concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father, and you will see Me no more;

verses.latin: de judicio vero, quia princeps hujus mundi jam judicatus est.
verses.english: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
