verses.latin: Multa habeo vobis dicere, sed non potestis portare modo.
verses.english: I still have many things to tell you, but you cannot bear them now.

verses.latin: Cum autem venerit ille Spiritus veritatis, docebit vos omnem veritatem: non enim loquetur a semetipso, sed quaecumque audiet, loquetur, et quae ventura sunt, annuntiabit vobis.
verses.english: But when He, the Spirit of truth, comes, He will guide you into all truth. For He will not speak on His own, but whatever He hears, He will speak, and He will declare to you the things that are to come.

verses.latin: Ille me clarificabit, quia de meo accipiet, et annuntiabit vobis.
verses.english: He will glorify Me, because He will take what is Mine and declare it to you.

verses.latin: Omnia quaecumque habet Pater, mea sunt. Propterea dixi, quia de meo accipiet, et annuntiabit vobis.
verses.english: All that the Father has is Mine; therefore I said that He will take what is Mine and declare it to you.

verses.latin: Modicum, et jam non videbitis me: et iterum modicum, et videbitis me: quia vado ad Patrem.
verses.english: A little while, and you will see Me no longer, and again a little while, and you will see Me, because I am going to the Father.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ex discipulis ejus ad invicem: Quid est hoc quod dicit nobis: Modicum, et non videbitis me: et iterum modicum, et videbitis me: et quia vado ad Patrem?
verses.english: Some of His disciples then said to one another, “What does He mean by this that He says to us, ‘A little while, and you will see Me no longer,’ and, ‘Again a little while, and you will see Me,’ and, ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo: Quid est hoc quod dicit: Modicum? nescimus quid loquitur.
verses.english: So they were saying, “What does He mean by ‘a little while’? We do not know what He is talking about.”

verses.latin: Cognovit Jesus quia volebant eum interrogare, et dixit eis: De hoc quaeritis inter vos, quia dixi: Modicum, et non videbitis me: et iterum modicum, et videbitis me?
verses.english: Jesus knew that they wanted to question Him, and He said to them, “Are you discussing this among yourselves, that I said, ‘A little while, and you will not see Me, and again a little while, and you will see Me’?

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico vobis: quia plorabitis et flebitis vos, mundus autem gaudebit: vos contristabimini, sed tristitia vestra vertetur in gaudium.
verses.english: Truly, truly, I say to you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice; you will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

verses.latin: Mulier cum parit, tristitiam habet, quia venit hora ejus: cum autem pepererit puerum, jam non meminit pressurae propter gaudium, quia natus est homo in mundum.
verses.english: When a woman is giving birth, she has sorrow because her hour has come; but when she has given birth to the baby, she no longer remembers the anguish because of the joy that a child has been born into the world.

verses.latin: Et vos igitur nunc quidem tristitiam habetis: iterum autem videbo vos, et gaudebit cor vestrum: et gaudium vestrum nemo tollit a vobis.
verses.english: So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

verses.latin: Et in die illa me non interrogabitis quidquam. Amen, amen dico vobis: si quid petieritis Patrem, dabit vobis in nomine meo.
verses.english: In that day, you will not question Me about anything. Truly, truly, I say to you, if you ask the Father for anything in My name, He will give it to you.

verses.latin: Usque modo non petistis quidquam in nomine meo: petite, et accipietis, ut gaudium vestrum sit plenum.
verses.english: Until now, you have not asked for anything in My name; ask, and you will receive, so that your joy may be made full.

verses.latin: Haec in proverbiis dixi vobis. Venit hora, quando jam non in proverbiis loquar vobis, sed palam de Patre annuntiabo vobis.
verses.english: I have spoken to you these things in figures of speech; the hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly of the Father.

verses.latin: In illo die in nomine meo petetis: et non dico vobis quia ego rogabo Patrem pro vobis:
verses.english: In that day you will ask in My name, and I do not say to you that I will ask the Father on your behalf;

verses.latin: ipse enim Pater amat vos, quia vos me amastis, et credidistis quia ego a Deo exivi.
verses.english: for the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me and have believed that I came forth from God.

verses.latin: Exivi a Patre, et veni in mundum: iterum relinquo mundum, et vado ad Patrem.
verses.english: I came from the Father and have come into the world; again, I am leaving the world and going to the Father.

verses.latin: Dicunt ei discipuli ejus: Ecce nunc palam loqueris, et proverbium nullum dicis.
verses.english: His disciples said, “Now You are speaking plainly and not using any figure of speech.

verses.latin: Nunc scimus quia scis omnia, et opus non habes ut quis te interroget. In hoc credimus quia a Deo existi.
verses.english: Now we know that You know all things and have no need for anyone to question You; by this we believe that You came from God.

verses.latin: Respondit eis Jesus: Modo creditis?
verses.english: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?

verses.latin: Ecce venit hora, et jam venit, ut spargamini unusquisque in propria, et me solum relinquatis: et non sum solus, quia Pater mecum est.
verses.english: Behold, the hour is coming, and has already come, for you to be scattered, each to his own home, and to leave Me alone; and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.

verses.latin: Haec locutus sum vobis, ut in me pacem habeatis. In mundo pressuram habebitis: sed confidite, ego vici mundum.
verses.english: I have said these things to you, that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.”

verses.latin: Haec locutus est Iesus, et levatis oculis in caelum, dixit: Pater, venit hora: clarifica Filium tuum, ut Filius glorificet te,
verses.english: After Jesus said these things, He looked up to the universe and said, “Father, the time has come! Glorify Your Son, so that Your Son can glorify You.

verses.latin: sicut dedisti ei potestatem omnis carnis, ut omne quod dedisti ei, det eis vitam aeternam.
verses.english: You have already given Him authority over all people, so that He might give eternal life to all those whom You have given to Him.

verses.latin: Haec est autem vita aeterna: ut cognoscant te solum Deum verum, et quem misisti, Iesum Christum.
verses.english: This is eternal life: that they might know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom You sent on a mission.

verses.latin: Ego te clarificavi super terram: opus consummavi, quod dedisti mihi ut faciam.
verses.english: I have glorified You on the earth, by accomplishing the work that You gave Me to do.

verses.latin: Et nunc clarifica me tu, Pater, apud temetipsum, gloria qua habui, priusquam mundus esset, apud te.
verses.english: And now, Father, glorify Me in Your presence, with the glory that I had with You before the universe existed.

verses.latin: Manifestavi nomen tuum hominibus quos dedisti mihi de mundo. Tui erant, et mihi eos dedisti: et verbum tuum servaverunt.
verses.english: I have revealed Your name to the men whom You gave Me out of the world. They were Yours, and You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.

verses.latin: Nunc cognoverunt quia omnia, quae dedisti mihi, a te sunt:
verses.english: Now they know that everything You have given Me comes from You.

verses.latin: quia verba, quae dedisti mihi, dedi eis: et ipsi acceperunt, et cognoverunt vere quia a te exivi, et crediderunt quia tu me misisti.
verses.english: For I have given them the words that You gave Me, and they have received them and truly understood that I came from You, and they have believed that You sent Me.

verses.latin: Ego pro eis rogo: non pro mundo rogo, sed pro his quos dedisti mihi: quia tui sunt:
verses.english: I pray for them. I do not pray for the world, but for those whom You have given Me, because they are Yours.

verses.latin: et mea omnia tua sunt, et tua mea sunt: et glorificatus sum in eis.
verses.english: All My things are Yours, and Yours are Mine, and I am glorified in them.

verses.latin: Et iam non sum in mundo, et hi in mundo sunt, et ego ad te venio. Pater sancte, serva eos in nomine tuo quos dedisti mihi: ut sint unum, sicut et nos.
verses.english: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to You. Holy Father, keep them in Your name, those whom You have given Me, so that they may be one, as We are.

verses.latin: Quando eram cum eis, ego servabam eos in nomine tuo. Quos dedisti mihi, custodivi: et nemo ex eis periit, nisi filius perditionis, ut scriptura impleretur.
verses.english: While I was with them, I kept them in Your name. I guarded those whom You gave Me, and not one of them has been lost except the son of perdition, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

verses.latin: Nunc autem ad te venio: et haec loquor in mundo, ut habeant gaudium meum impletum in semetipsis.
verses.english: But now I am coming to You, and these things I speak in the world, so that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.

verses.latin: Ego dedi eis verbum tuum, et mundus odio eos habuit, quia non sunt de mundo, sicut et ego non sum de mundo.
verses.english: I have given them Your word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

verses.latin: Non rogo ut tollas eos de mundo, sed ut serves eos a malo.
verses.english: I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should protect them from evil.

verses.latin: De mundo non sunt, sicut et ego non sum de mundo.
verses.english: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

verses.latin: Sanctifica eos in veritate. Sermo tuus veritas est.
verses.english: Sanctify them in the truth. Your word is truth.

verses.latin: Sicut tu me misisti in mundum, et ego misi eos in mundum:
verses.english: As You sent Me into the world, so I have sent them into the world.

verses.latin: et pro eis ego sanctifico meipsum, ut sint et ipsi sanctificati in veritate.
verses.english: And for their sakes, I sanctify Myself, so that they also may be sanctified in truth.

verses.latin: Non pro his autem rogo tantum, sed et pro eis qui credituri sunt per verbum eorum in me:
verses.english: I do not pray for these only, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word,

verses.latin: ut omnes unum sint, sicut tu Pater in me, et ego in te: ut et ipsi in nobis unum sint: ut credat mundus quia tu me misisti.
verses.english: that they all may be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You, so that they also may be one in Us, so that the world may believe that You sent Me.

verses.latin: Et ego claritatem, quam dedisti mihi, dedi eis: ut sint unum, sicut et nos unum sumus.
verses.english: And I have given them the glory that You have given Me, so that they may be one, just as We are one.

verses.latin: Ego in eis, et tu in me: ut sint perfecti in unum: et cognoscat mundus quia tu me misisti, et dilexisti eos, sicut me dilexisti.
verses.english: I in them, and You in Me, so that they may be perfected in one, and that the world may know that You sent Me and that You have loved them, as You have loved Me.

verses.latin: Pater, quod dedisti mihi, volo ut ubi ego sum, et illi sint mecum: ut videant gloriam meam, quam dedisti mihi: quia dilexisti me ante mundi constitutionem.
verses.english: Father, I desire that those whom You have given Me may be with Me where I am, so that they may see My glory that You have given Me, because You loved Me before the foundation of the world.

verses.latin: Pater iuste, et mundus te non cognovit: ego autem te cognovi: et hi cognoverunt quia tu me misisti.
verses.english: O righteous Father, the world has not known You, but I have known You, and these have known that You sent Me.

verses.latin: Et notum feci eis nomen tuum, et notum faciam: ut dilectio qua dilexisti me, in ipsis sit, et ego in ipsis.
verses.english: And I have made Your name known to them, and I will make it known, so that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”

verses.latin: Haec cum dixisset Iesus, exiit cum discipulis suis trans torrentem Cedron, ubi erat hortus, in quem intrauit ipse, et discipuli eius.
verses.english: After Jesus had said this, he went out with his disciples across the river of Kidron. Where there was a garden, into which he entered, and his disciples.

verses.latin: Sciebat autem et Iudas, qui tradebat eum, locum: quia saepius Iesus cum discipulis suis illuc conuenit.
verses.english: Now Judas, who was betraying him, knew the place, because Jesus often met there with his disciples.

verses.latin: Iudas ergo cum cohortem et ex archiepiscopis et Pharisaeis accepit, uenit illuc cum lanternis et facibus et armis.
verses.english: Then Judas, having received a cohort and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.

verses.latin: Iesus itaque sciens omnia quae uentura erant super eum, processit et dixit eis: Quem quaeritis?
verses.english: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that would happen to him, went forth and said to them, "Whom are you seeking?"

verses.latin: Responderunt ei: Iesum Nazarenum. Dicit eis Iesus: Ego sum. Stabat autem et cum eis Iudas, qui tradebat eum.
verses.english: They answered him, "Jesus of Nazareth." Jesus said to them, "I am." And Judas, who was betraying him, was standing with them.

verses.latin: Ut ergo dixit eis: Ego sum, abierunt retrorsum et ceciderunt in terram.
verses.english: When therefore he said to them, "I am," they went backward and fell to the ground.

verses.latin: Iterum ergo interrogauit eos: Quem quaeritis? Illi autem dixerunt: Iesum Nazarenum.
verses.english: Again therefore he asked them, "Whom are you seeking?" And they said, "Jesus of Nazareth."

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Dixi uobis quia ego sum. Si ergo me quaeritis, sinite hos abire.
verses.english: Jesus answered, "I told you that I am. If therefore you are seeking me, let these go their way."

verses.latin: Ut sermo impleretur quem dixit: Quia quos dedisti mihi, non perdidi ex eis quemquam.
verses.english: That the word might be fulfilled which he said: "I have not lost any of those whom you gave me."

verses.latin: Simon ergo Petrus habens gladium, eduxit eum et percussit seruum principis sacerdotum, et abscidit auriculam eius. Erat autem nomen seruo Malchus.
verses.english: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear. And the name of the servant was Malchus.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Iesus Petro: Mitte gladium tuum in uaginam. Calicem quem dedit mihi Pater, non bibam illum?
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to Peter, "Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink the cup that the Father has given me?"

verses.latin: Cohors ergo, et tribunus, et ministri Iudaeorum, comprehenderunt Iesum,
verses.english: Then the cohort, the tribune, and the officers of the Jews, arrested Jesus,

verses.latin: et ligauerunt eum: et adduxerunt eum ad Annam primum: erat enim Annas gener Caiphae, qui erat pontifex anni illius.
verses.english: and bound him: and they led him to Annas first, for Annas was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year.

verses.latin: Erat autem Caiphas, qui consilium dederat Iudaeis: Quia expedit unum hominem mori pro populo.
verses.english: Now Caiaphas was he who had given counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

verses.latin: Sequebatur autem Iesum Simon Petrus, et alius discipulus. Discipulus autem ille notus erat pontifici, et introiuit cum Iesu in atrium pontificis.
verses.english: And Simon Peter was following Jesus, and another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and he went in with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.

verses.latin: Petrus autem stabat ad ostium foris. Exiit ergo alius discipulus, qui notus erat pontifici, et dixit ostiariae, et introiuit Petrum.
verses.english: But Peter was standing at the door outside. Therefore the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the woman who kept the door, and brought Peter in.

verses.latin: Dicit ergo ancilla ostiaria Petro: Nonne tu es et tu ex discipulis hominis istius?
verses.english: Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, "Are you not also one of this man’s disciples?"

verses.latin: Dicit ille: Non sum.
verses.english: He said, "I am not."

verses.latin: Stabant autem servi et ministri ad carbones, quia frigus erat, et calefiebant: erat autem cum eis et Petrus stans et calefaciens se.
verses.english: Now the servants and the officers were standing at a fire of coals, because it was cold, and they were warming themselves. And Peter was also with them, standing and warming himself.

verses.latin: Pontifex ergo interrogauit Iesum de discipulis suis, et de doctrina eius.
verses.english: The high priest therefore questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his doctrine.

verses.latin: Respondit ei Iesus: Ego palam locutus sum mundo: ego semper docui in synagoga et in templo, quo omnes Iudaei conueniunt: et in occulto nihil locutus sum.
verses.english: Jesus answered him, "I have spoken openly to the world. I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where all the Jews gather, and in secret I have spoken nothing.

verses.latin: Quid me interrogas? Interroga eos qui audierunt quid locutus sim eis: ecce hi sciunt quae dixerim ego.
verses.english: Why do you question me? Question those who have heard what I have spoken to them. Behold, they know what things I have said."

verses.latin: Haec autem cum dixisset, unus ex ministris assistens, dedit alapam Iesu, dicens: Sic respondes pontifici?
verses.english: And when he had said this, one of the officers standing by struck Jesus with a slap, saying, "Do you answer the high priest so?"

verses.latin: Respondit ei Iesus: Si male locutus sum, testimonium perhibe de malo: si autem bene, quid me caedis?
verses.english: Jesus answered him, "If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why do you strike me?"

verses.latin: Misit ergo eum Annas ligatum ad Caiphani pontificem.
verses.english: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.

verses.latin: Erat autem Simon Petrus stans, et calefaciens se. Dixerunt ergo ei: Nonne et tu ex discipulis eius es?
verses.english: And Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, "Are you not also one of his disciples?"

verses.latin: Ille negauit, et dixit: Non sum.
verses.english: He denied it and said, "I am not."

verses.latin: Eunt ergo a Caipha in praetorium: et erat mane: et ipsi non introierunt in praetorium, ut non contaminarentur, sed ut manducarent pascha.
verses.english: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the praetorium, and it was morning; and they themselves did not enter into the praetorium, so that they might not be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.

verses.latin: Exiuit ergo Pilatus foras ad eos, et dixit: Quam accusationem affertis aduersus hunc hominem?
verses.english: Pilate therefore went out to them and said, "What accusation do you bring against this man?"

verses.latin: Responderunt et dixerunt ei: Si non esset hic malefactor, non tibi tradidissemus eum.
verses.english: They answered and said to him, "If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him to you."

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Pilatus: Sumite eum uos, et iudicate eum secundum legem uestram. Dixerunt ergo ei Iudaei: Nobis non licet interficere quemquam.
verses.english: Then Pilate said to them, "Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law." The Jews said therefore to him, "It is not lawful for us to put any man to death."

verses.latin: Ut sermo Iesu impleretur, quem dixit, significans qua morte esset moriturus.
verses.english: That the word of Jesus might be fulfilled which he spoke, signifying by what death he would die.

verses.latin: Intrauit ergo iterum in praetorium Pilatus, et uocauit Iesum, et dixit ei: Tu es rex Iudaeorum?
verses.english: Pilate therefore entered again into the praetorium, and called Jesus, and said to him, "Are you the King of the Jews?"

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: A temetipso hoc dicis, an alii dixerunt tibi de me?
verses.english: Jesus answered, "Do you say this of yourself, or have others told you about me?"

verses.latin: Respondit Pilatus: Numquid ego Iudaeus sum? Gens tua, et pontifices tradiderunt te mihi: quid fecisti?
verses.english: Pilate answered, "Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests have delivered you to me. What have you done?"

verses.latin: Respondit Iesus: Regnum meum non est de hoc mundo. Si ex hoc mundo esset regnum meum, ministri mei utique decertarent ut non traderer Iudaeis: nunc autem regnum meum non est hinc.
verses.english: Jesus answered, "My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would certainly strive that I should not be delivered to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here."

verses.latin: Dixit itaque ei Pilatus: Ergo rex es tu? Respondit Iesus: Tu dicis quia rex sum. Ego in hoc natus sum, et ad hoc ueni in mundum, ut testimonium perhibeam ueritati: omnis qui est ex ueritate, audit uocem meam.
verses.english: Pilate therefore said to him, "So you are a king?" Jesus answered, "You say that I am a king. For this I was born, and for this I came into the world, that I should bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears my voice."

verses.latin: Dicit ei Pilatus: Quid est ueritas? Et cum hoc dixisset, iterum exiuit ad Iudaeos, et dicit eis: Ego nullam in eo causam inuenio.
verses.english: Pilate said to him, "What is truth?" And when he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and said to them, "I find in him no crime at all."

verses.latin: Est autem consuetudo uobis ut unum dimittam uobis in Pascha: uultis ergo dimittam uobis regem Iudaeorum?
verses.english: But it is your custom that I should release one to you at the Passover. Will you therefore that I release to you the King of the Jews?"

verses.latin: Clamauerunt ergo iterum omnes, dicentes: Non hunc, sed Barabbam. Erat autem Barabbas latro.
verses.english: Then they cried out again, saying, "Not this man, but Barabbas." Now Barabbas was a robber.

verses.latin: Tunc ergo surrexit Pilatus, et jussit Jesum flagellari.
verses.english: Then Pilate had Jesus flogged.

verses.latin: Et milites, plectentes coronam de spinis, imposuerunt capiti ejus: et veste purpurea induebant eum.
verses.english: And the soldiers wove a crown of thorns, placed it on his head, and dressed him in a purple robe.

verses.latin: Et veniebant ad eum, et dicebant: Ave, rex Judæorum! Et dabant ei alapas.
verses.english: They approached him and said, "Hail, King of the Jews!" And they struck him.

verses.latin: Exiit ergo iterum Pilatus foras, et dicit eis: Ecce, adduco vobis eum foras, ut cognoscatis quia nullam invenio in eo causam.
verses.english: Pilate went outside again and said to them, "I am bringing him out to you so you may know that I find no fault in him."

verses.latin: Exiit itaque Jesus portans coronam spinarum, et purpureum. Et dicit eis: Ecce homo!
verses.english: Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, "Behold the man!"

verses.latin: Cum ergo vidissent eum pontifices et ministri, clamabant dicentes: Crucifige, crucifige eum! Dicit eis Pilatus: Tollite eum vos, et crucifigite: ego enim non invenio in eo causam.
verses.english: When the chief priests and the guards saw him, they shouted, "Crucify him! Crucify him!" Pilate said to them, "Take him yourselves and crucify him. I find no fault in him."

verses.latin: Responderunt ei Judæi: Nos legem habemus, et secundum legem debet mori: quia Filium Dei se fecit.
verses.english: The Jews answered him, "We have a law, and according to that law he must die, because he claimed to be the Son of God."

verses.latin: Cum ergo audisset Pilatus hunc sermonem, magis timuit.
verses.english: When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est in prætorium iterum: et dixit ad Jesum: Unde es tu? Sed Jesus responsionem non dedit ei.
verses.english: He entered the praetorium again and said to Jesus, "Where are you from?" But Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.latin: Dicit ergo ei Pilatus: Mihi non loqueris? nescis quia potestatem habeo crucifigere te, et potestatem habeo dimittere te?
verses.english: So Pilate said to him, "Do you refuse to speak to me? Do you not know that I have power to release you and power to crucify you?"

verses.latin: Respondit Jesus: Non haberes potestatem adversum me ullam, nisi tibi datum esset desuper. Propterea qui me tradidit tibi, majori peccato habet.
verses.english: Jesus answered, "You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore, the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin."

verses.latin: Exinde quærebant eum Pilatus dimittere. Judæi autem clamabant, dicentes: Si hunc dimittis, non es amicus Cæsaris. Omnis enim qui se regem facit, contradicit Cæsari.
verses.english: From then on Pilate tried to release him, but the Jews kept shouting, "If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar. Everyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar."

verses.latin: Pilatus autem, cum audisset hos sermones, adduxit foras Jesum: et sedit pro tribunali in loco qui dicitur Lithostrotos, Hebraice autem Gabbatha.
verses.english: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside and sat on the judgment seat at a place called the Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

verses.latin: Erat autem parasceve Paschæ, hora quasi sexta, et dicit Judæis: Ecce rex vester!
verses.english: It was the day of Preparation of the Passover, about noon. Pilate said to the Jews, "Here is your king!"

verses.latin: Illi autem clamabant: Tolle, tolle, crucifige eum! Dicit eis Pilatus: Regem vestrum crucifigam? Responderunt pontifices: Non habemus regem, nisi Cæsarem.
verses.english: They shouted, "Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!" Pilate said to them, "Shall I crucify your king?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king but Caesar."

verses.latin: Tunc ergo tradidit eis illum ut crucifigeretur. Susceperunt autem Jesum, et eduxerunt eum.
verses.english: So he handed him over to them to be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led him away.

verses.latin: Et baiulans sibi crucem, exiit in eum qui dicitur Calvariæ locus, Hebraice Golgotha:
verses.english: Bearing his own cross, he went out to the place called the Place of the Skull, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha.

verses.latin: ubi crucifixerunt eum, et cum eo alios duos, hinc et hinc, medium autem Jesum.
verses.english: There they crucified him, and with him two others, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.

verses.latin: Scripsit autem et titulum Pilatus, et posuit super crucem. Erat autem scriptum: Jesus Nazarenus, rex Judæorum.
verses.english: Pilate also wrote a title and put it on the cross. It read: "Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews."

verses.latin: Hunc ergo titulum multi Judæorum legerunt: quia prope civitatem erat locus ubi crucifixus est Jesus: et erat scriptum Hebraice, Græce, et Latine.
verses.english: Many of the Jews read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo Pilato pontifices Judæorum: Noli scribere: Rex Judæorum: sed quod ipse dixit: Rex sum Judæorum.
verses.english: So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, "Do not write 'King of the Jews,' but that he said, 'I am King of the Jews.'"

verses.latin: Respondit Pilatus: Quod scripsi, scripsi.
verses.english: Pilate answered, "What I have written, I have written."

verses.latin: Milites ergo cum crucifixissent eum, acceperunt vestimenta ejus (et fecerunt quatuor partes), unicuique militi partem, et tunicam. Erat autem tunica inconsutilis, desuper contexta per totum.
verses.english: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four shares, one for each soldier, and also his tunic. The tunic was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.

verses.latin: Dixerunt ergo ad invicem: Non scindamus eam, sed sortiamur de illa, cujus sit: ut Scriptura impleretur, dicens: Diviserunt sibi vestimenta mea: et in vestimentum meum miserunt sortem. Et milites quidem hæc fecerunt.
verses.english: So they said to one another, "Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it to see whose it will be," so that the scripture might be fulfilled which says: "They divided my garments among them, and for my vesture they cast lots." This is what the soldiers did.

verses.latin: Stabant autem juxta crucem Jesu mater ejus, et soror matris ejus, Maria Cleophæ, et Maria Magdalene.
verses.english: Standing by the cross of Jesus were his mother and his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

verses.latin: Cum vidisset ergo Jesus matrem, et discipulum stantem, quem diligebat, dicit matri suæ: Mulier, ecce filius tuus.
verses.english: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, "Woman, behold, your son!"

verses.latin: Deinde dicit discipulo: Ecce mater tua. Et ex illa hora accepit eam discipulus in sua.
verses.english: Then he said to the disciple, "Behold, your mother!" And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home.

verses.latin: Post hæc sciens Jesus quia jam omnia consummata sunt, ut consummaretur Scriptura, dixit: Sitio.
verses.english: After this, when Jesus knew that all was now finished, he said, to fulfill the scripture, "I am thirsty."

verses.latin: Vas ergo erat positum aceto plenum. Illi autem spongiam plenam aceto, hyssopo circumponentes, obtulerunt ori ejus.
verses.english: A jar full of sour wine stood there, so they put a sponge full of the sour wine on a branch of hyssop and held it to his mouth.

verses.latin: Cum ergo accepisset Jesus acetum, dixit: Consummatum est. Et inclinato capite tradidit spiritum.
verses.english: When Jesus had received the sour wine, he said, "It is finished." And bowing his head, he gave up his spirit.

verses.latin: Judæi ergo, quoniam parasceve erat, ut non remanerent in cruce corpora sabbato (erat enim magnus dies ille sabbati), rogaverunt Pilatum ut frangerentur eorum crura, et tollerentur.
verses.english: The Jews therefore, because it was the day of Preparation, so that the bodies should not remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a high day), asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo milites, et primi quidem fregerunt crura, et alterius qui crucifixus est cum eo.
verses.english: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him.

verses.latin: Ad Jesum autem cum venissent, viderunt eum jam mortuum: et non fregerunt ejus crura.
verses.english: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

verses.latin: Sed unus militum lancea latus ejus aperuit, et continuo exivit sanguis et aqua.
verses.english: But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water flowed out.

verses.latin: Et qui vidit, testimonium perhibuit: et verum est testimonium ejus. Et ille scit quia vera dicit: ut et vos credatis.
verses.english: He who saw it has borne witness, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, so that you also may believe.

verses.latin: Facta sunt enim hæc, ut Scriptura impleretur: Os non confringetis ex eo.
verses.english: For these things happened so that the scripture might be fulfilled: "Not a bone of him will be broken."

verses.latin: Et iterum alia Scriptura dicit: Videbunt in quem transfixerunt.
verses.english: And again another scripture says, "They will look on him whom they pierced."

verses.latin: Post hæc autem Joseph ab Arimathæa (eo quod esset discipulus Jesu, sed timidus propter Judæos), rogavit Pilatum ut tolleret corpus Jesu: et permisit Pilatus. Venit ergo, et tulit corpus Jesu.
verses.english: After these things, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus. And Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took away the body of Jesus.

verses.latin: Venit autem et Nicodemus (is qui nocte venerat ad Jesum primum), ferens mixturam myrrhæ et aloes, quasi libras centum.
verses.english: Nicodemus also came, the one who had first come to Jesus by night, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.

verses.latin: Sumpuerunt ergo corpus Jesu, et ligaverunt illud linteis cum aromatibus, sicut mos est Judæis sepelire.
verses.english: So they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in linen cloths with the spices, according to the burial custom of the Jews.

verses.latin: Erat autem in loco, ubi crucifixus est, hortus: et in horto monumentum novum, in quo nondum quisquam positus erat.
verses.english: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb where no one had ever been laid.

verses.latin: Ibi ergo propter parasceven Judæorum, quia juxta erat monumentum, posuerunt Jesum.
verses.english: So because of the Jewish day of Preparation, since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.

verses.latin: Die autem una sabbati, mane, cum adhuc tenebrae essent, venit Maria Magdalene ad monumentum: et videt lapidem amotum a monumento.
verses.english: On the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark. And she saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.

verses.latin: Currrit ergo, et venit ad Simonem Petrum, et ad alium discipulum, quem amabat Iesus, et dicit eis: Tulerunt Dominum de monumento, et nescimus ubi posuerunt eum.
verses.english: She ran to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid him.”

verses.latin: Exiit ergo Petrus, et ille alius discipulus, et venerunt ad monumentum.
verses.english: Peter therefore went out with the other disciple, and they were going toward the tomb.

verses.latin: Currebant autem duo simul, et ille alius discipulus praecucurrit citius Petro, et venit primus ad monumentum.
verses.english: And they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came first to the tomb.

verses.latin: Et cum se inclinasset, vidit linteamina posita: sed non introivit.
verses.english: And stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying there, but he did not go in.

verses.latin: Simon ergo Petrus venit sequens eum, et introivit in monumentum, et vidit linteamina posita,
verses.english: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb. And he saw the linen cloths lying,

verses.latin: et sudarium, quod fuerat super caput eius, non cum linteis positum, sed separatim involutum in unum locum.
verses.english: and the napkin that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths but rolled up in a place by itself.

verses.latin: Tunc ergo introivit et alius discipulus, qui venerat primus ad monumentum: et vidit, et credidit.
verses.english: Then the other disciple, who had come first to the tomb, also went in, and he saw and believed.

verses.latin: Nondum enim sciebant Scripturam, quia oportet eum a mortuis resurgere.
verses.english: For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

verses.latin: Abierunt ergo iterum discipuli ad semetipsos.
verses.english: Then the disciples went back to their homes.

verses.latin: Maria autem stabat ad monumentum foris, plorans. Dum ergo fleret, inclinavit se, et prospexit in monumentum,
verses.english: But Mary was standing outside the tomb, weeping. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb,

verses.latin: et vidit duos angelos in albis sedentis, unum ad caput, et unum ad pedes, ubi positum fuerat corpus Iesu.
verses.english: and she saw two angels in white, sitting where the body of Jesus had lain, one at the head and the other at the feet.

verses.latin: Dicunt ei illi: Mulier, quid ploras? Dicit eis: Quia tulerunt Dominum meum: et nescio ubi posuerunt eum.
verses.english: And they said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid him.”

verses.latin: Haec cum dixisset, conversa est retrorsum, et vidit Iesum stantem: et non sciebat quia Iesus est.
verses.english: Having said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, but she did not know that it was Jesus.

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Mulier, quid ploras? quem quaeris? Illa existimans quia hortulanus est, dicit ei: Domine, si tu sustulisti eum, dic mihi ubi posuisti eum, et ego eum tollam.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?” Supposing him to be the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Maria. Conversa illa, dicit ei: Rabboni (quod dicitur Magister).
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him in Hebrew, “Rabboni!” (which means Teacher).

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Noli me tangere: nondum enim ascendi ad Patrem meum. Vade autem ad fratres meos, et dic eis: Ascendo ad Patrem meum et Patrem vestrum, et Deum meum et Deum vestrum.
verses.english: Jesus said to her, “Do not cling to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father; but go to my brothers and say to them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

verses.latin: Venit Maria Magdalene annuntians discipulis: Quia vidi Dominum, et haec dixit mihi.
verses.english: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and that he had said these things to her.

verses.latin: Cum esset ergo sero die illa una sabbati, et fores essent clausae ubi erant discipuli propter metum Iudaeorum, venit Iesus, et stetit in medio, et dicit eis: Pax vobis.
verses.english: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the doors being shut where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be with you.”

verses.latin: Et hoc cum dixisset, ostendit eis manus et latus. Gavisi sunt ergo discipuli, viso Domino.
verses.english: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis iterum: Pax vobis. Sicut misit me Pater, et ego mitto vos.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, even so I am sending you.”

verses.latin: Et cum hoc dixisset, insufflavit, et dixit eis: Accipite Spiritum Sanctum:
verses.english: And when he had said this, he breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: quorum remiseritis peccata, remittuntur eis: et quorum retinueritis, retenta sunt.
verses.english: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you withhold forgiveness from any, it is withheld.”

verses.latin: Thomas autem unus ex duodecim, qui dicitur Didymus, non erat cum eis quando venit Iesus.
verses.english: Now Thomas, one of the twelve, called the Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.

verses.latin: Dicebant ergo ei alii discipuli: Vidimus Dominum. Ille autem dixit eis: Nisi videro in manibus eius signum clavorum, et mittam digitum meum in signum clavorum, et mittam manum meam in latus eius, non credam.
verses.english: So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord.” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the mark of the nails, and place my finger into the mark of the nails, and place my hand into his side, I will never believe.”

verses.latin: Et post dies octo, iterum erant discipuli intra, et Thomas cum eis. Venit Iesus, ianuis clausis, et stetit in medio, et dixit: Pax vobis.
verses.english: Eight days later, his disciples were inside again, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being closed, and stood in the midst, and said, “Peace be with you.”

verses.latin: Deinde dicit Thomae: Infer digitum tuum huc, et vide manus meas, et affer manum tuam, et mitte in latus meum: et noli esse incredulus, sed fidelis.
verses.english: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and see my hands; and put out your hand, and place it in my side. Do not disbelieve, but believe.”

verses.latin: Respondit Thomas, et dixit ei: Dominus meus, et Deus meus.
verses.english: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Quia vidisti me, credidisti: beati qui non viderunt, et crediderunt.
verses.english: Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”

verses.latin: Multa quidem et alia signa fecit Iesus in conspectu discipulorum suorum, quae non sunt scripta in libro hoc.
verses.english: Now Jesus did many other signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book;

verses.latin: Haec autem scripta sunt, ut credatis quia Iesus est Christus Filius Dei: et ut credentes vitam habeatis in nomine eius.
verses.english: but these are written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.

verses.latin: Post haec manifestavit se iterum Iesus discipulis ad mare Tiberiadis: et sic se manifestavit.
verses.english: After these things, Jesus again showed himself to his disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and he showed himself in this way.

verses.latin: Erant simul Simon Petrus, et Thomas, qui dicitur Didymus, et Nathanael, qui erat a Cana Galilaeae, et filii Zebedaei, et alii ex discipulis eius duo.
verses.english: Simon Peter was present, and Thomas, who is called Didymus, and Nathanael, who was from Cana of Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.

verses.latin: Dicit eis Simon Petrus: Vado piscari. Dicunt ei: Venimus et nos tecum. Exierunt et ascenderunt in navim: et illa nocte nihil prendiderunt.
verses.english: Simon Peter said to them, "I am going fishing." They said to him, "We are coming with you." They went out and entered the boat, and that night they caught nothing.

verses.latin: Mane autem facto, stetit Iesus in littore: non tamen cognoverunt discipuli quia Iesus est.
verses.english: But when the morning was come, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Pueri, numquid pulmentarium habetis? Responderunt ei: Non.
verses.english: Jesus therefore said to them, "Children, have you any meat?" They answered him, "No."

verses.latin: Dixit eis: Mittite rete in latus navis, et invenietis. Miserunt ergo, et iam non valebant illud trahere prae multitudine piscium.
verses.english: He said to them, "Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find." They cast it therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo discipulus ille, quem amabat Iesus, Petro: Dominus est. Simon Petrus cum audisset quia Dominus est, tunicam succinxit se (erat enim nudus) et misit se in mare.
verses.english: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter, "It is the Lord." Simon Peter, when he heard that it was the Lord, girded his tunic about him (for he was naked) and cast himself into the sea.

verses.latin: Alii autem discipuli in navicula venerunt (non enim longe a terra, sed quasi cubitis ducentis), trahentes rete piscium.
verses.english: But the other disciples came in the boat (for they were not far from the land, but as it were two hundred cubits), drawing the net of fishes.

verses.latin: Cum ergo descendissent in terram, viderunt prunas positas, et piscem superpositum, et panem.
verses.english: When therefore they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

verses.latin: Dicit eis Iesus: Adferte de piscibus quos prendidistis nunc.
verses.english: Jesus said to them, "Bring of the fishes which you have now caught."

verses.latin: Ascendit Simon Petrus, et traxit rete in terram, plenum magnis piscibus, centum quinquaginta tribus. Et cum tanti essent, non est scissa rete.
verses.english: Simon Peter went up and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, one hundred and fifty-three. And although there were so many, the net was not broken.

verses.latin: Dicit eis Iesus: Venite, prandete. Et nemo audebat discumbentium interrogare eum: Quis es? scientes quia Dominus est.
verses.english: Jesus says to them, "Come and dine." And none of those who were reclining dared to ask him, "Who are you?" knowing that it was the Lord.

verses.latin: Et venit Iesus, et accepit panem, et dedit eis, et piscem similiter. Hoc iam tertio manifestatus est Iesus discipulis, cum resurrexisset a mortuis.
verses.english: And Jesus came, and took bread, and gave to them, and fish in like manner. This is now the third time that Jesus was manifested to his disciples, after he was risen from the dead.

verses.latin: Cum ergo prandissent, dicit Simoni Petro Iesus: Simon Ioannis, diligis me plus his? Dicit ei: Etiam Domine, tu scis quia amo te. Dicit ei: Pasce agnos meos.
verses.english: When therefore they had dined, Jesus says to Simon Peter, "Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?" He says to him, "Yes, Lord, you know that I love you." He says to him, "Feed my lambs."

verses.latin: Dicit ei iterum: Simon Ioannis, diligis me? Dicit ei: Etiam Domine, tu scis quia amo te. Dicit ei: Pasce agnos meos.
verses.english: He says to him again, "Simon, son of John, do you love me?" He says to him, "Yes, Lord, you know that I love you." He says to him, "Feed my lambs."

verses.latin: Dicit ei tertio: Simon Ioannis, amas me? Contristatus est Petrus, quia dixit ei tertio: Amas me? Et dixit ei: Domine, tu omnia scis, tu scis quia amo te. Dicit ei: Pasce oves meas.
verses.english: He says to him the third time, "Simon, son of John, do you love me?" Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time, "Do you love me?" And he said to him, "Lord, you know all things; you know that I love you." He says to him, "Feed my sheep."

verses.latin: Amen, amen dico tibi: Cum esses junior, cingebas te, et ambulabas ubi volebas: cum autem senueris, extendes manus tuas, et alius te cinget, et ducet quo tu non vis.
verses.english: Amen, amen I say to you, when you were younger, you girded yourself, and walked where you would; but when you are old, you will stretch forth your hands, and another will gird you, and lead you where you do not want to go."

verses.latin: Hoc autem dixit significans qua morte clarificaturus esset Deum. Et cum hoc dixisset, dicit ei: Sequere me.
verses.english: Now he said this, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had said this, he says to him, "Follow me."

verses.latin: Conversus Petrus, videt illum discipulum quem amabat Iesus, sequentem, qui et recubuit in cena super pectus eius, et dixit: Domine, quis est qui tradit te?
verses.english: Peter turning about, saw that disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, "Lord, who is he that betrays you?"

verses.latin: Hunc ergo cum vidisset Petrus, dicit Iesu: Domine, hic autem quid?
verses.english: Peter therefore seeing him, says to Jesus, "Lord, and what of this man?"

verses.latin: Dicit ei Iesus: Sic eum volo manere donec venio, quid ad te? Tu sequere me.
verses.english: Jesus says to him, "So I will have him to remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me."

verses.latin: Exivit ergo sermo iste in fratres, quia discipulus ille non moritur. Et non dixit ei Iesus: Non moritur: sed, Sic eum volo manere donec venio, quid ad te?
verses.english: This saying therefore went abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die. And Jesus did not say to him, "He shall not die"; but, "So I will have him to remain until I come, what is that to you?"

verses.latin: Hic est discipulus ille, qui testimonium perhibet de his, et scripsit haec: et scimus quia verum est testimonium eius.
verses.english: This is the disciple who gives testimony of these things, and has written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.

verses.latin: Sunt autem et alia multa, quae fecit Iesus: quae si scribantur per singula, nec ipsum arbitror mundum capere eos, qui scribendi sunt libros.
verses.english: But there are also many other things which Jesus did; which, if they were written every one, the world itself, I think, would not be able to contain the books that should be written.
